Point Luna.name: Point Luna
Point Luna.economy: 38 MC + 1 ti-prod (12.5 MC). Space + Earth теги. Effect: draw card per Earth tag. 5-10 Earth тегов = 15-40 MC free card draw.
Point Luna.reasoning: Card draw от Earth тегов решает фундаментальную проблему engine: economy + card draw одновременно. Earth теги распространённые и хорошие карты. По COTD: shai_aus — 'one of the best engine corps', benbever — 'one of the best'.
Point Luna.when_to_pick: Почти всегда pick. Только пропускай если 0 Earth тегов в стартовых 10 (очень редко). S-tier.

CrediCor.name: CrediCor
CrediCor.economy: 57 MC — один из лучших стартов. +4 MC при покупке карт за 20+ MC и SP Greenery/City. 3-5 триггеров за игру = 12-20 MC бонус.
CrediCor.reasoning: Топ-тир по единогласному мнению сообщества. Высокий старт позволяет покупать лучшие карты gen 1. Работает с любой стратегией. По COTD: shai_aus — 'one of the best', benbever — 'Top tier in all settings'.
CrediCor.when_to_pick: Почти всегда. Один из самых безопасных picks в игре.

Manutech.name: Manutech
Manutech.economy: 35 MC + 1 steel-prod. Эффект: при поднятии production получи ресурсы немедленно. За 8-9 gen = 30-50+ MC в immediate value. Strip Mine = 2 steel + 1 ti сразу.
Manutech.reasoning: Сломанная корпорация, которую многие банят. Превращает каждую production-карту в огромную скидку. Низкий старт (35 MC) — единственный сдерживающий фактор. По COTD: 'absolutely top tier', 'on my ban list', 'genuinely broken'.
Manutech.when_to_pick: Почти всегда. Даже средний хенд с Manutech лучше хорошего с большинством корпораций.

EcoLine.name: EcoLine
EcoLine.economy: 36 MC — низкий старт. 2 plant-prod (16 MC) + 3 plants. 7 plants/greenery (экономия 1 plant/greenery). Ground game powerhouse.
EcoLine.reasoning: Машина для ground game. 7 plants/greenery + 2 plant-prod = быстрые greeneries. На Tharsis (Gardener, Landlord) — одна из лучших. По COTD: benbever и shai_aus — top-tier с правильной рукой.
EcoLine.when_to_pick: Plant production карты в руке. Лучше на Tharsis/Elysium. Осторожно на Hellas.

Vitor.name: Vitor
Vitor.economy: 48 MC + free award (8-20 MC saved). Earth тег. +3 MC per VP card played. 5-10 VP cards = 15-30 MC.
Vitor.reasoning: +3 MC на VP карты абсурдно хорош — VP карты и так лучшие в игре, Vitor делает их ещё лучше. Free award = strategic advantage. По COTD: shai_aus — 'absolutely top tier', icehawk84 — 'insane how much money you can save'.
Vitor.when_to_pick: Почти всегда. Особенно с VP-heavy рукой. Top 5 corp overall.

Tharsis Republic.name: Tharsis Republic
Tharsis Republic.economy: 40 MC + free city (placement bonus + ~2 MC-prod from city + 1 MC-prod from effect = ~18-22 MC). Building тег. +1 MC-prod per city. В 3P 8-12 cities = 40-60 MC.
Tharsis Republic.reasoning: Passive MC-prod от ВСЕХ cities (свои + opponents') отлична в 3P. Free city gen 1 = immediate value. По COTD: benbever — top-tier на Tharsis map. icehawk84 — between 'overrated' (beginners) и 'underrated' (competitive).
Tharsis Republic.when_to_pick: Сильный generic pick. Особенно на Tharsis. С city-картами и production strategy.

Lakefront Resorts.name: Lakefront Resorts
Lakefront Resorts.economy: 54 MC + passive income от океанов. 9 океанов = до 9 MC-prod. С прелюдиями 2-3 океана gen 1 = 2-3 MC-prod сразу. Building тег.
Lakefront Resorts.reasoning: Одна из сильнейших корпораций. 54 MC — высокий старт. Пассивная income от океанов гарантирована. По COTD: Krazyguy75, shai_aus — 'one of the strongest', 'generically strong'.
Lakefront Resorts.when_to_pick: Почти всегда. Особенно с ocean-прелюдиями. Работает на любой карте.

Poseidon.name: Poseidon
Poseidon.economy: 45 MC + 1 MC-prod + free colony (~15-20 MC). Нет тегов. +1 MC-prod per colony placed by anyone = 3-6 MC-prod за игру.
Poseidon.reasoning: Free colony + MC-prod от всех colony placements = огромный economic advantage. По COTD: jaminfine — 'one of the absolute best', rekenner — 'devs did not understand Colonies'. No-tag penalty — единственная слабость. Colony-dependent.
Poseidon.when_to_pick: Когда strong colonies in play. Одна из лучших в colony games.

Philares.name: Philares
Philares.economy: 47 MC + free greenery (19 MC: 1 TR + O2 + placement bonus). Building тег. Effect: при adjacent tile placement gain resource = 5-10+ triggers = 15-30 MC.
Philares.reasoning: Free greenery ценнее чем free city (Tharsis Republic). Adjacency effect rewards board presence. В 3P больше tile placements = больше triggers. По COTD: benbever — 'really strong (top tier)', shai_aus — 'great'.
Philares.when_to_pick: Почти всегда сильна. Особенно с tile-placing картами.

Teractor.name: Teractor
Teractor.economy: 60 MC — высший non-resource старт. Earth тег. -3 MC на Earth tags. 5-8 Earth тегов за игру = 15-24 MC экономии.
Teractor.reasoning: 60 MC стартовый капитал = огромная flexibility gen 1. Earth tag discount стекается с Earth Office. По COTD: shai_aus — 'slightly below Credicor', но всё равно great. Safe, reliable, strong.
Teractor.when_to_pick: Почти всегда safe pick. Особенно с Earth тегами в руке.

Helion.name: Helion
Helion.economy: 42 MC + 3 heat-prod. Heat=MC для Helion — огромная flexibility. Space тег. Ловушка: нельзя постоянно конвертировать heat, это убивает TR.
Helion.reasoning: Надёжная B-tier корпорация с хорошим floor. 3 heat-prod — встроенная GHG Factories. В 3P WGT temp поднимается быстро, но Helion всё равно получает value от конвертации. По COTD: shai_aus — 'real ability is starting with 3 heat production'.
Helion.when_to_pick: Почти всегда хорош. Особенно с heat/energy прелюдиями. Лучше на Hellas.

Valley Trust.name: Valley Trust
Valley Trust.economy: 37 MC + extra prelude (~28-32 MC при выборе из 3). Earth тег. -2 MC на science cards = 6-10 MC saved.
Valley Trust.reasoning: Extra prelude — мощный gen 1 boost. Выбор из 3 = обычно 25-30+ MC value. Science discount consistently useful. По COTD: shai_aus — 'quite strong'. Solid but not amazing.
Valley Trust.when_to_pick: Почти всегда safe pick. Extra prelude = flexibility и power. На Hellas (Scientist award) чуть лучше.

Interplanetary Cinematics.name: Interplanetary Cinematics
Interplanetary Cinematics.economy: 30 MC + 20 steel (40 MC при 2 MC/steel). Building тег. +2 MC per event = 8-16 MC за игру. Но если нет building-карт, фактический старт = 30 MC.
Interplanetary Cinematics.reasoning: Высокий ceiling (70 MC effective), но ужасный floor (30 MC без building-карт). По COTD: benbever — великолепен с steel-dump, плох без. Крайне зависим от стартовой руки.
Interplanetary Cinematics.when_to_pick: ТОЛЬКО если в руке 2+ building-карт для сброса steel gen 1. Без steel-targets — слабая.

Spire.name: Spire
Spire.economy: 50 MC + draw 4 keep 1 (filtering). City + Earth теги. Effect: +1 science per 2+ tag card. Sciences = 2 MC each на SP. 8-12 science = 16-24 MC.
Spire.reasoning: Сильный старт (50 MC) + отличная card filtering. Science accumulation для SP discounts consistent. По COTD: icehawk84 — 'decent corp', benbever — 'strong and fun', fuzzyplastic — 'really fun and powerful'.
Spire.when_to_pick: Хороший generic pick. Лучше когда ожидаешь SP использование.

Cheung Shing MARS.name: Cheung Shing MARS
Cheung Shing MARS.economy: 44 MC + 3 MC-prod (15-18 MC) = ~62 MC. Building тег. -2 MC на building tag карты. 5-8 building тегов за игру = 10-16 MC экономии.
Cheung Shing MARS.reasoning: Стабильная, надёжная корпорация. 3 MC-prod = отличный ранний income. Building тег для Builder milestone. По COTD: shai_aus и benbever оценивают солидно.
Cheung Shing MARS.when_to_pick: Универсальный pick. Хорош с building-рукой. Не выбирай если рука Space/ti heavy.

PolderTECH Dutch.name: PolderTECH Dutch
PolderTECH Dutch.economy: 35 MC + free ocean (12-14 MC) + free greenery (19 MC) = ~66-68 MC. Earth тег. 2 TR + placement bonuses gen 1.
PolderTECH Dutch.reasoning: Сильный first-action: 2 TR от ocean + oxygen + placement bonuses. 35 MC стартовый низкий, но компенсируется free tiles. Earth тег полезен. Без COTD данных, математика ставит на solid B-tier.
PolderTECH Dutch.when_to_pick: Хороший generic pick. Immediate TR и tiles сильны gen 1.

Morning Star Inc..name: Morning Star Inc.
Morning Star Inc..economy: 50 MC + 3 Venus карты + ±2 Venus req. Venus тег.
Morning Star Inc..reasoning: Высокий стартовый капитал. 3 гарантированные Venus карты. ±2 req = ранний Stratospheric Birds. Venus стратегия ситуативная.
Morning Star Inc..when_to_pick: Venus карты в стартовых, engine стратегия.

Nirgal Enterprises.name: Nirgal Enterprises
Nirgal Enterprises.economy: 30 MC + 1 energy + 1 plant + 1 steel prod. 3 тега. Free milestones (8 MC) + free awards (8/14/20 MC). Реально 20-30 MC savings в 3P.
Nirgal Enterprises.reasoning: Ужасный старт (30 MC) с потенциально мощной способностью. Бесплатные milestones/awards ценны, но нужно ВЫПОЛНИТЬ условия. По COTD: Krazyguy75 — 'strong but boring', SoupsBane — 'really bad'.
Nirgal Enterprises.when_to_pick: Прелюдии компенсируют низкий старт И есть путь к 1-2 milestones.

Septem Tribus.name: Septem Tribus
Septem Tribus.economy: 36 MC + Wild тег. Action: +2 MC per party с вашим delegate. Max 12 MC/action. Но delegates стоят 5 MC each. Net ~30-50 MC.
Septem Tribus.reasoning: 12 MC/turn ceiling сильный, но требует значительных delegate инвестиций. 36 MC старт низкий. Wild тег полезен. По COTD: benbever — 'pretty strong' при setup, SonicN — 'spread delegates thin'.
Septem Tribus.when_to_pick: С Turmoil и возможностью инвестировать в delegates рано.

Saturn Systems.name: Saturn Systems
Saturn Systems.economy: 42 MC + 1 ti-prod (12.5 MC) + Jovian тег (3-5 MC). +1 MC-prod per Jovian tag played. В 3P реально 3-6 Jovian тегов = 15-30 MC.
Saturn Systems.reasoning: Ti-prod и Jovian тег — main value. MC-prod от Jovian decent но Jovian тегов мало и дороги. По COTD: shai_aus — 'going heavy Jovian usually a trap'. Susceptible к hate-drafting.
Saturn Systems.when_to_pick: Jovian карты в руке и ti-prod prelude. Лучше с меньшим количеством игроков.

EcoTec.name: EcoTec
EcoTec.economy: 42 MC + 1 plant-prod (8 MC) = ~50 MC. Microbe+Plant теги. Effect: при plant/microbe/animal теге +2 plants или +2 microbes.
EcoTec.reasoning: Viral Enhancers на корпорации. Двойной тег (Microbe+Plant) полезен для Splice, Decomposers, Ecologist. Но 42 MC + 1 plant-prod — слабый старт. VP passive.
EcoTec.when_to_pick: Bio-heavy рука с microbe targets. На Elysium (Ecologist).

Robinson Industries.name: Robinson Industries
Robinson Industries.economy: 47 MC + action (increase lowest prod for 4 MC). Gen 1: ti-prod за 4 MC = отличная сделка. Нет тегов.
Robinson Industries.reasoning: Выглядит хорошо на бумаге, но по COTD: benbever — 'performs poorly in tournaments'. No tag hurt. Action менее полезна со временем. shai_aus — 'worst of Prelude corps, but not bad'.
Robinson Industries.when_to_pick: Decent generic pick. Ранний ti/energy prod за 4 MC хорош gens 1-2.

Inventrix.name: Inventrix
Inventrix.economy: 45 MC + 3 cards (~10 MC) + Science тег (3-5 MC). Эффект ±2 steps — условные 5-8 MC за игру.
Inventrix.reasoning: Средняя корпорация, лучше на бумаге чем на практике. Science тег ценен, 3 карты приятны, но нет recurring engine. По COTD: shai_aus — 'not very good'. ±2 steps в 3P WGT мало решает.
Inventrix.when_to_pick: Нужен Science тег или карты с жёсткими requirements. На Hellas (Scientist award) чуть лучше.

Mons Insurance.name: Mons Insurance
Mons Insurance.economy: 48 MC + 4 MC-prod. Оппоненты -2 MC-prod each. Но insurance payouts -3 MC per attack. Нет тегов.
Mons Insurance.reasoning: Сильный стартовый пакет, но payouts и отсутствие тегов компенсируют. В 3P меньше атак чем в 4-5P. Ants — recurring nightmare. По COTD: 'very good in 2P, average in 3P'.
Mons Insurance.when_to_pick: При отсутствии лучших альтернатив. Избегай если видишь Ants у оппонентов.

Sagitta Frontier Services.name: Sagitta Frontier Services
Sagitta Frontier Services.economy: 31 MC + 1 energy + 2 MC-prod. Effect: +1 MC per missing tag on played cards. Single-tag cards +1 MC. No-tag cards +4 MC.
Sagitta Frontier Services.reasoning: Mild discount — 1 MC per single-tag card play. No-tag cards (4 MC bonus) редки. 31 MC стартовый низкий. Energy-prod полезна с Colonies. По COTD: warpspeed100 — 1 MC rebate на single-tag — main value.
Sagitta Frontier Services.when_to_pick: С production прелюдиями. Energy помогает с Colonies.

Arklight.name: Arklight
Arklight.economy: 45 MC + 2 MC-prod (10-12 MC) = ~57 MC. Animal тег. VP: +1 animal за plant/animal тег → 1 VP/2 animals. Реально 2-3 VP за игру.
Arklight.reasoning: Приличный стартовый капитал с MC-prod, но способность — только VP, никакой помощи ранней экономике. В 3P WGT с короткими играми 2-3 VP от способности это скромная добавка. По COTD: 'ok but boring'.
Arklight.when_to_pick: Рука с plant/animal картами. На Elysium (Ecologist milestone).

Viron.name: Viron
Viron.economy: 48 MC + Microbe тег. Action: use blue card action again this gen. Value = 0 MC без targets, broken с AI Central.
Viron.reasoning: Extreme variance. С AI Central / Electro Catapult = amazing. Без targets = 48 MC с microbe тегом и нет ability. По COTD: shai_aus — 'beastly with right blue cards', icehawk84 — 'on average, one of the weaker corps'.
Viron.when_to_pick: ТОЛЬКО с AI Central или premium action card в стартовой руке. Не надеяться найти позже.

Aridor.name: Aridor
Aridor.economy: 40 MC — низкий старт. Дополнительная колония (~10 MC). Способность: +1 MC-prod за новый тип тега. Реально 6-8 MC-prod за игру = 30-40 MC total, но растянуто во времени.
Aridor.reasoning: Сильный потенциал MC-prod, но низкий старт делает gen 1-2 болезненными. В 3P WGT игры короче (8-9 gen), production value снижается. Нет тегов. Высокая вариативность.
Aridor.when_to_pick: Много дешёвых карт с разными тегами в стартовой руке. Лучше с Venus (11-й тег). Не брать если рука дорогая.

Mining Guild.name: Mining Guild
Mining Guild.economy: 30 MC + 5 steel + 1 steel-prod. Эффект: +1 steel-prod за steel/ti бонус на карте. Steel overflow — серьёзная проблема. 2 Building тега.
Mining Guild.reasoning: Объективно слабая корпорация. 30 MC — мало. Steel overflow: производишь больше steel чем тратишь. По COTD: 'low tier', 'expansions weakened it'. Лучше на Tharsis (Builder + Miner).
Mining Guild.when_to_pick: На Tharsis с ocean-прелюдиями и steel-dump картами.

PhoboLog.name: PhoboLog
PhoboLog.economy: 23 MC + 10 titanium (30-50 MC). Space тег. Ti worth +1 MC each. Но 23 MC cash — нужны space карты.
PhoboLog.reasoning: Locks into space-heavy strategy. 23 MC — почти невозможно купить non-space карты. По COTD: shai_aus — 'locks you into space strategy', icehawk84 — 'took 55 games for someone to win'. Feast-or-famine.
PhoboLog.when_to_pick: ТОЛЬКО с Io Mining Industries или 2+ дорогих space карт И ti-prod. Иначе пропускай.

Pristar.name: Pristar
Pristar.economy: 53 MC - 2 TR penalty (~16 MC lost). +6 MC/gen when not terraforming. 5-6 non-terraform gens = 30-36 MC + 5-6 VP.
Pristar.reasoning: Требует fundamentally другой playstyle. -2 TR серьёзный penalty. В 3P WGT игры быстрее, меньше non-terraform gens. По COTD: benbever — 'can be strong with right preludes', FieldMouse007 — 'weak'. High skill cap.
Pristar.when_to_pick: Strong production прелюдии и VP карты без TR. Очень специфичный playstyle.

Factorum.name: Factorum
Factorum.economy: 37 MC + 1 steel-prod (8 MC) = ~45 MC. Action: +1 energy-prod ИЛИ pay 3 MC → draw card. Power + Building теги.
Factorum.reasoning: Низкий стартовый капитал (37 MC) — серьёзный минус. Energy gen 1 полезна с Колониями. Без Колоний — действие на cards слабое. По COTD: icehawk84 — лучше с Colonies но средняя.
Factorum.when_to_pick: С Colonies и energy-картами. Без Colonies — ниже среднего.

Palladin Shipping.name: Palladin Shipping
Palladin Shipping.economy: 36 MC + 5 ti. Конфликт: ti нужен для карт и для action. Phobolog делает то же лучше.
Palladin Shipping.reasoning: Низкий старт (51 MC vs 63 средний). Rush стратегия, но мало денег.

Tycho Magnetics.name: Tycho Magnetics
Tycho Magnetics.economy: 42 MC + 1 energy-prod. Action: spend energy → look at cards. Science + Power теги.
Tycho Magnetics.reasoning: Низкий старт (~49.5 MC). Action не работает gen 1. С Colonies конфликт energy для trade.
Tycho Magnetics.when_to_pick: Income прелюдии, science/energy карты, длинная игра.

Thorgate.name: Thorgate
Thorgate.economy: 48 MC + 1 energy-prod. Power тег. -3 MC на energy SP и energy tag cards. Energy SP = 8 MC (vs 11). 3-5 energy тегов = 9-15 MC saved.
Thorgate.reasoning: По COTD: Krazyguy75 — 'limit to how much energy you want'. shai_aus — 'not great'. -3 MC discount на energy tags нишевый. Power тег worthless. С Colonies чуть лучше (energy для trade).
Thorgate.when_to_pick: С Colonies и Standard Technologies. Без них — ниже среднего.

Utopia Invest.name: Utopia Invest
Utopia Invest.economy: 40 MC + 1 steel-prod + 1 ti-prod = ~60.5 MC. Building тег. Action: decrease any production → gain 4 of that resource.
Utopia Invest.reasoning: Приличный production start, но 40 MC tight. Action на конвертацию production в ресурсы — нишевая, полезна late game. По COTD: warpspeed100 — можно в минус по MC-prod; shai_aus — 'interesting but situational'.
Utopia Invest.when_to_pick: Building/space карты для steel и titanium. Action — nice late-game option.

Arcadian Communities.name: Arcadian Communities
Arcadian Communities.economy: 40 MC + 10 steel (~20 MC) = ~60 MC. Способность: +3 MC за тайл рядом с маркером. Нет тегов — штраф -3 to -5 MC.
Arcadian Communities.reasoning: Зависит от tile placement карт. В 3P area denial менее ценна. Без тегов теряются все corp-синергии. Нишевая — сильна на Elysium, но в целом ненадёжна.
Arcadian Communities.when_to_pick: Elysium с city-тяжёлой рукой. На Tharsis/Hellas — почти никогда.

Stormcraft Incorporated.name: Stormcraft Incorporated
Stormcraft Incorporated.economy: 48 MC + Jovian тег. Action: +1 floater. Floaters = 2 heat each. По сути ~2 heat-prod. Медленно.
Stormcraft Incorporated.reasoning: По COTD: icehawk84 — 'mediocre, effect very weak, like 2 heat prod'. Floater-to-heat конвертация плохая. Jovian тег — самая ценная часть. Floater карты обычно слабые.
Stormcraft Incorporated.when_to_pick: Хорошие Jovian multipliers и floater targets. Jovian тег — главный аргумент.

Celestic.name: Celestic
Celestic.economy: 42 MC + 2 floater-карты (~6-8 MC). Venus тег. Action: +1 floater, 1 VP/3 floaters. За 7 gen = ~2 VP.
Celestic.reasoning: Floater-стратегия — trap в большинстве игр. Хороших floater-карт мало. 42 MC ниже среднего. По COTD: icehawk84 — все Venus-корпорации кроме Manutech 'pretty bad'.
Celestic.when_to_pick: Venus-тяжёлая рука с хорошими floater targets.

Pharmacy Union.name: Pharmacy Union
Pharmacy Union.economy: 54 MC + Science card. -4 MC per microbe tag played by anyone. В 3P оппоненты играют 6-10 microbe тегов = -24 to -40 MC drain! Flip даёт 3 TR = 21 MC.
Pharmacy Union.reasoning: Best case: быстро cure с science тегами. Worst case: opponents drain ваши деньги. В 3P много microbe тегов в колоде. По COTD: shai_aus — 'complete disaster every time'. Вариативность слишком высока.
Pharmacy Union.when_to_pick: Только с 3+ science тегами для быстрого cure gen 1-2. Очень рискованно в 3P.

Aphrodite.name: Aphrodite
Aphrodite.economy: 47 MC + 1 plant-prod (8 MC) = ~55 MC. Способность +2 MC за каждый Venus raise — в 3P Venus поднимается 4-6 раз за игру = 8-12 MC бонус за всю игру, пассивно.
Aphrodite.reasoning: Способность почти не контролируется — зависит от того, поднимают ли оппоненты Venus. Plant-prod не синергирует с Venus. По данным COTD: icehawk84 считает все Venus-корпорации кроме Manutech слабыми.
Aphrodite.when_to_pick: Почти никогда. Только если обе альтернативы хуже и в руке Venus-карты.

Kuiper Cooperative.name: Kuiper Cooperative
Kuiper Cooperative.economy: 33 MC + 1 ti-prod (12.5 MC) = ~45.5 MC. Астероиды тратятся ТОЛЬКО на temperature/ocean SP. Ивенты НЕ считаются.
Kuiper Cooperative.reasoning: Слабая корпорация с ужасным стартом (33 MC). Ивенты не триггерят ability. Астероиды ограничены 2 SP. По COTD: 'weakest of the Prelude 2 KS pack'.
Kuiper Cooperative.when_to_pick: Почти никогда. Одна из самых слабых корпораций.

Recyclon.name: Recyclon
Recyclon.economy: 38 MC + 1 steel-prod. Microbe + Building теги. 3 building тега → 1 plant prod. Glacially slow.
Recyclon.reasoning: По COTD: Krazyguy75 — 'buildings didn't show up in expansions'. shai_aus — 'locks into cards you don't want'. jaminfine — 'no greeneries until mid/late game'. Slow conversion rate.
Recyclon.when_to_pick: Только с 2+ building preludes И хорошими building картами. Обычно outclassed.

Astrodrill.name: Astrodrill
Astrodrill.economy: 35 MC + 3 asteroid resources (~9 MC). Action медленная: 2 действия на 3 titanium. Asteroid-карт в колоде мало.
Astrodrill.reasoning: Крайне низкий старт (35 MC). Ability медленная и non-synergistic. По COTD: Krazyguy75 и shai_aus — 'non-interactive, non-synergistic, slow', 'it has never won'.

Splice.name: Splice
Splice.economy: 44 MC + 1 Microbe card. При microbe теге: +2 MC или +2 microbes — но оппонент тоже получает выбор! Microbe тегов мало.
Splice.reasoning: Power даёт 2 MC per microbe tag но ТАКЖЕ даёт оппоненту 2 MC/microbes. Microbe тегов мало. По COTD: Krazyguy75 — 'very weak', icehawk84 — 'awful and unfun'.
Splice.when_to_pick: Только с microbe-heavy рукой. Очень редко лучший pick.

United Nations Mars Initiative.name: United Nations Mars Initiative
United Nations Mars Initiative.economy: 40 MC + Earth тег. Action: pay 3 MC → +1 TR (if already raised TR this gen). 4 MC net profit per use. Но 40 MC и 3 MC/gen cost — tight.
United Nations Mars Initiative.reasoning: По COTD: Krazyguy75 — 'TR is an awful source of VP and MC production'. shai_aus — 'not good'. Нужно уже поднять TR чтобы использовать — double spending. 40 MC start мало.
United Nations Mars Initiative.when_to_pick: Почти никогда. Только с очень эффективными TR-raising картами.

Polyphemos.name: Polyphemos
Polyphemos.economy: 50 MC + 5 MC-prod + 5 titanium. НО +2 MC cost per card = ~48 MC penalty за игру! Нет тегов.
Polyphemos.reasoning: По COTD: Krazyguy75 — 'one of the worst corporations in the entire game'. +2 MC per card purchase devastates engine building. shai_aus — 'once you burn through resources, crippling downside'. В 3P WGT нельзя не покупать карты.
Polyphemos.when_to_pick: Почти никогда. Только с alternative card draw И ti-heavy картами.

Terralabs Research.name: Terralabs Research
Terralabs Research.economy: 14 MC - 1 TR penalty. Keep all 10 cards free. -1 MC card purchase. Science + Earth теги. Но 14 MC старт = нельзя играть карты gen 1.
Terralabs Research.reasoning: По COTD: Krazyguy75 — mathematical takedown показывает corp mispriced. benbever — 'bottom tier, extremely low starting funds'. 14 MC gen 1 = fatal в 3P WGT.
Terralabs Research.when_to_pick: Почти никогда. Даже с incredible free картами — слишком рискованно.

Beginner Corporation.name: Beginner Corporation
Beginner Corporation.economy: 42 MC + 10 бесплатных карт (без draft). Нет тегов. Нет способности. Для обучения, не для competitive play.
Beginner Corporation.reasoning: Не предназначена для competitive play. Нет тега, нет способности, случайные карты без draft.
Beginner Corporation.when_to_pick: Только для обучения новичков. Никогда в competitive.

Project Eden.name: Project Eden
Project Eden.economy: 1 ocean (12 MC) + 1 city (~8 MC) + 1 greenery (~12 MC) + placement bonuses (~6-10 MC) - 3 cards (~9 MC). City+Plant tags ~3 MC. Total ~32-36 MC.
Project Eden.reasoning: Arguably the most broken prelude in the game. 3 tile placements in gen 1 is insane tempo — ocean + city + greenery gives 2 TR + VP + placement bonuses + adjacency potential. Discarding 3 cards is a small price. COTD consensus: 'ridiculously strong' (benbever), 'sooo busted' (icehawk84). Many groups house-rule it. City+Plant tags are a nice bonus.
Project Eden.when_to_pick: Always. This is the strongest standard prelude. Pick it every time you see it.

High Circles.name: High Circles
High Circles.reasoning: Политическое доминирование + отличная рука. Influence = постоянная защита.

Great Aquifer.name: Great Aquifer
Great Aquifer.economy: 2 oceans = 2 TR (~14-15 MC) + 2 placement bonuses (~4-8 MC average). Kickstarts ground game. Total ~18-23 MC direct, but strategic value much higher.
Great Aquifer.reasoning: Top-tier prelude. 2 oceans provides immediate 2 TR, excellent placement bonuses (up to 2 cards + 2 ti on Tharsis), and controls the ocean track. Enables Arctic Algae, Kelp Farming. COTD consensus: 'among the best preludes' (icehawk84), 'top tier, kickstarts ground game' (ad_hocNC). Strategic value exceeds raw MC calculation.
Great Aquifer.when_to_pick: Almost always a strong pick. Best on Tharsis (placement bonuses). Slightly less good if you have zero ground game cards.

Huge Asteroid.name: Huge Asteroid
Huge Asteroid.economy: 3 temp steps = 3 TR (~21-22 MC) + heat-prod from 0->-2 step = ~4 MC. -5 MC cost. Total ~20 MC direct, but 3 TR is massive tempo.
Huge Asteroid.reasoning: Excellent rush prelude. 3 TR is the highest immediate TR from any standard prelude. The heat production from temp steps is a bonus. The -5 MC is a real cost but 3 TR + heat prod is worth it. Unlocks temperature-dependent cards. COTD (benbever): 'in the top 10 best preludes by quantified value'.
Huge Asteroid.when_to_pick: Strong in rush strategies. Good when you have temp-requirement cards. The 5 MC cost means less good if you're cash-starved.

UNMI Contractor.name: UNMI Contractor
UNMI Contractor.economy: 3 TR = 3 MC-prod + 3 VP = ~21 MC immediate (3 x 7 MC). 1 card = 3-4 MC. Earth tag ~2-3 MC. Total ~26-28 MC.
UNMI Contractor.reasoning: Top-tier prelude. 3 TR is massive tempo — 3 MC-prod + 3 VP that kicks in immediately. The card draw and Earth tag are bonuses. COTD community rating: very high. Compares favorably to Allied Bank (trades 1 MC-prod for 3 VP + card). Excellent for TR rush. One of the safest, most reliable preludes.
UNMI Contractor.when_to_pick: Almost always a top pick. Especially good for TR rush strategies and Point Luna (Earth tag + card).

Experimental Forest.name: Experimental Forest
Experimental Forest.reasoning: Greenery gen 1 = 1 TR + placement bonus. 2 выбранные Plant карты = engine. Plant тег ценный.

Planetary Alliance.name: Planetary Alliance
Planetary Alliance.reasoning: 4 TR immediate = massive tempo. Earth тег для Point Luna. Один из лучших rush прелюдий.

Allied Bank.name: Allied Bank
Allied Bank.economy: 4 MC-prod = 20-24 MC gen 1. +3 MC immediate. +Earth tag ~2-3 MC. Total ~25-30 MC.
Allied Bank.reasoning: One of the best production preludes. 4 MC-prod is flexible and always useful. Earth tag is relevant for Point Luna, Cartels, Space Hotels. No downside, no requirements. Slightly below Business Empire ceiling but more reliable (no cost).
Allied Bank.when_to_pick: Almost always a good pick. Slightly better in longer games (more gens to benefit from production).

Metal-Rich Asteroid.name: Metal-Rich Asteroid
Metal-Rich Asteroid.economy: 1 temp step = 1 TR (~7 MC) + heat-prod bonus. 4 ti = 12 MC, 4 steel = 8 MC. Total ~28-30 MC if metals are spent.
Metal-Rich Asteroid.reasoning: High value prelude (~30 MC when metals are spent). 1 TR is immediate tempo. 4 ti + 4 steel provides flexible gen 1 spending for both space and building cards. COTD (benbever): 'top 10 best preludes'. The key condition is having cards to spend the metals on — if you don't, metals are worth less. No tags is the only downside.
Metal-Rich Asteroid.when_to_pick: When you have building and space cards to spend the metals. Almost always a strong pick.

Business Empire.name: Business Empire
Business Empire.economy: 6 MC-prod = 30-36 MC gen 1. -6 MC cost. Earth tag ~2-3 MC. Total ~26-33 MC net.
Business Empire.reasoning: High production value but the 6 MC cost delays payoff to gen 3. Better than Allied Bank in ceiling (6 vs 4 prod) but worse floor due to cost crippling gen 1 spending. Earth tag is nice. COTD: 'very popular, income is what you want gen 1'. Best with rich corps (Credicor, Teractor) that can absorb the cost.
Business Empire.when_to_pick: When you have enough starting MC to absorb the 6 MC cost without crippling gen 1. Better in longer games.

Atmospheric Enhancers.name: Atmospheric Enhancers
Atmospheric Enhancers.economy: 2 raises on any parameter = ~14-15 MC (2 TR). 2 floater-icon cards from reveal = ~8 MC. Venus tag ~2 MC. Total ~24-25 MC, but flexibility is huge.
Atmospheric Enhancers.reasoning: Extremely flexible — choose which parameter to raise based on board state. 2 TR is strong. The 2 floater-icon cards drawn are a bonus. Can unlock Venus requirements early (for Stratospheric Birds gen 1 with Venus L1 Shade combo). Venus tag relevant for Morning Star Inc and discounts.
Atmospheric Enhancers.when_to_pick: When you have Venus cards in hand or want flexible TR. Great with Morning Star Inc. Good even without Venus synergy since you can raise temp/O2.

Early Colonization.name: Early Colonization
Early Colonization.economy: Colony placement = ~13 MC. 3 energy = 1 trade = ~8-12 MC depending on colony. Space tag ~1 MC. Also moves tracks 2 steps up. Total ~24-28 MC.
Early Colonization.reasoning: Strong in Colony games. You get a colony + immediate trade capability (3 energy). The colony tracks move 2 steps forward as a bonus. Secures a spot on the best colony before anyone else. Space tag is minor. Less good if colonies are weak.
Early Colonization.when_to_pick: When strong colonies are in play and you have (or can get) 3 energy-prod for future trading. Top colony prelude.

Metals Company.name: Metals Company
Metals Company.economy: 1 MC-prod = 5 MC, 1 steel-prod = 8 MC, 1 ti-prod = 12.5 MC. No tags = -3 MC. Total ~22.5 MC. BUT diverse production is very flexible.
Metals Company.reasoning: Best pure-production prelude for engine building. Gives a bit of everything — MC for flexibility, steel for buildings, ti for space cards. No tags is a real penalty but the production diversity compensates. COTD consensus: 'great, gives a bit of everything' (shai_aus), 'literally the best income prelude' (FieldMouse007).
Metals Company.when_to_pick: Almost always good for engine-building strategies. Less good in pure rush. Solid default pick.

Soil Bacteria.name: Soil Bacteria
Soil Bacteria.economy: 2 Microbe тег карты + 3 microbes. ~24-28 MC с синергиями.
Soil Bacteria.reasoning: Microbe engine starter. 2 выбранные Microbe карты + 3 microbes для начала. Splice combo.

Double Down.name: Double Down
Double Down.economy: Копирует другой прелюд. Value = копия - потеря слота.
Double Down.reasoning: Зависит от парного прелюда. С Project Eden/Great Aquifer = S-tier. С плохим = F-tier.

Acquired Space Agency.name: Acquired Space Agency
Acquired Space Agency.economy: 6 ti = 18 MC (24 as Phobolog). 2 space cards from reveal = ~8-10 MC value (not random, you see before picking). Total ~26-28 MC but volatile.
Acquired Space Agency.reasoning: Above average value when you can spend the titanium on gen 1 space cards. The 2 revealed space cards add significant value — you know what opponents saw. Variance is the main downside: sometimes the ti has no good targets. No tags is a minor penalty.
Acquired Space Agency.when_to_pick: When you have space cards in hand or are playing Phobolog/Saturn Systems. Skip if your hand is all building/earth.

Polar Industries.name: Polar Industries
Polar Industries.economy: 2 heat-prod = 8 MC, 1 ocean = ~12 MC (1 TR + placement bonus). Building tag ~2 MC. Total ~22 MC direct, but ocean + heat synergy is strong.
Polar Industries.reasoning: Solid prelude combining terraforming (ocean) with heat engine. Better than Mohole because the ocean provides immediate TR + placement bonus. Building tag enables Robotic Workforce. COTD (benbever): 'above average, top 10 excluding promos'. Strong for rush strategies. Heat is less flexible but ocean compensates.
Polar Industries.when_to_pick: Good for rush or terraforming strategies. Ocean placement bonuses can be excellent on Tharsis.

Strategic Base Planning.name: Strategic Base Planning
Strategic Base Planning.economy: City = ~8-12 MC (placement bonus dependent), colony = ~13 MC. -3 MC cost. City+Building+Space tags ~4 MC. Total ~22-26 MC. Needs energy for trading.
Strategic Base Planning.reasoning: Strong in the right context: city + colony for 3 MC is excellent efficiency. 3 valuable tags (City, Building, Space). The catch: you need energy production to trade the colony, and city value depends on the map. COTD: 'extremely powerful in right circumstances' (CaptainCFloyd). Better in Colony games with energy available.
Strategic Base Planning.when_to_pick: When strong colonies are in play and you have energy for trading. Also good for Mayor milestone on Tharsis.

Corporate Archives.name: Corporate Archives
Corporate Archives.economy: 13 MC + look at 7, keep 2 cards = ~6-10 MC (better than random due to selection). Science tag ~3 MC. Total ~22-26 MC.
Corporate Archives.reasoning: Solid 'money now + smart card draw' prelude. The 7-card selection makes the 2 drawn cards significantly better than random (~8-10 MC value vs ~6-8 for random). Science tag is relevant. Less good with bad hands (digging for outs is unreliable). COTD: 'above average, good with good hands'.
Corporate Archives.when_to_pick: When your hand is already decent and you want to find specific synergy cards. The Science tag unlocks requirements. Skip if you need raw production.

Research Network.name: Research Network
Research Network.economy: 1 MC-prod = 5 MC, 3 cards = 9-12 MC. Wild tag value = highly variable, ~3-8 MC. Total ~17-25 MC depending on tag usage.
Research Network.reasoning: The Wild tag is the star — counts as any tag for NRA, milestones, awards, and corp abilities. With the right strategy (NRA, Science requirements, Jovian count), the tag alone can be worth 5-10 MC. 1 MC-prod + 3 cards provides modest development. COTD (shai_aus, 27 upvotes): 'I love this one, the Wild tag is amazing'. Less good without tag synergies.
Research Network.when_to_pick: When the Wild tag fills a critical need (NRA activation, milestone tag count). Less good if you just need raw production.

Space Lanes.name: Space Lanes
Space Lanes.economy: 3 Trade Fleet → 3 колонии. ~24-27 MC в Colony играх.
Space Lanes.reasoning: 3 colonies = massive Colony engine. Но без Colonies = бесполезен.
Space Lanes.when_to_pick: Только в Colony играх с хорошими колониями.

Aquifer Turbines.name: Aquifer Turbines
Aquifer Turbines.economy: 1 ocean = ~12 MC (1 TR + placement bonus). 2 energy-prod = 15 MC. -3 MC cost. Power tag ~1 MC. Total ~25 MC.
Aquifer Turbines.reasoning: Solid prelude with good total value. Ocean gives immediate TR + placement bonus (could be 2 cards on Tharsis). 2 energy-prod is excellent with Colonies (trade immediately) or energy-hungry cards (Strip Mine, Electro Catapult). The -3 MC is minor. Less good without energy sinks.
Aquifer Turbines.when_to_pick: When you have energy sinks in hand or are playing with Colonies. Good on Tharsis for ocean placement bonuses.

Merger.name: Merger
Merger.economy: Draw 4 corps, play 1, pay 42 MC. Net = second corp's ability + starting MC - 42. Extremely variable: from +50 MC (great corp synergy) to -20 MC (bad draws).
Merger.reasoning: The most volatile prelude. When it hits (Tharsis + Point Luna combo, etc.), it's game-winning. When it misses, you paid 42 MC for a mediocre second corp with depleted resources. COTD: 'broken in the literal sense — pure RNG' (Krazyguy75). No tags. The fun factor is high but reliability is low. Score reflects average expected value.
synergies: Valley Trust (9 preludes to look at)
Merger.when_to_pick: When your current setup is mediocre and you're willing to gamble. Skip if you already have a strong hand — the 42 MC cost is real.

Smelting Plant.name: Smelting Plant
Smelting Plant.economy: 2 O2 steps = 2 TR (~14-15 MC) + 5 steel = 10 MC. Building tag ~2 MC. Total ~26-27 MC.
Smelting Plant.reasoning: Good value prelude with immediate 2 TR from oxygen. 5 steel is a nice bonus if you have building cards. Building tag enables Robotic Workforce and steel discount. COTD (benbever): 'high value, ~30 MC worth'. Slightly less good if O2 track is the easiest to complete anyway (your greeneries will not give TR). Can be better for engine players counterintuitively.
Smelting Plant.when_to_pick: When you have building cards to spend the steel. Good if O2 unlocks requirement cards. Solid TR prelude.

Supply Drop.name: Supply Drop
Supply Drop.economy: 3 ti = 9 MC, 8 steel = 16 MC, 3 plants = ~5 MC. No tags = -3 MC. Total ~27 MC IF resources spent.
Supply Drop.reasoning: High raw value (~27 MC) when you can spend all resources. 8 steel is a lot — you need building cards. 3 ti needs space cards. 3 plants can contribute to an early greenery. The catch: no production means no recurring value. COTD: 'quite strong' (ad_hocNC). No tags hurts. Best in shorter games where immediate resources > production.
Supply Drop.when_to_pick: When you have building + space cards to spend resources immediately. Less good without targets.

Ecology Experts.name: Ecology Experts
Ecology Experts.economy: 1 plant-prod = 8 MC. Free card play ignoring requirements = 0-30+ MC depending on target. Plant+Microbe tags ~3 MC. Total ~11 MC (no target) to ~40+ MC (Kelp Farming/NRA).
Ecology Experts.reasoning: Extremely swingy. With Kelp Farming, Trees, Bushes, or NRA in hand — one of the best preludes in the game. Without a strong target — one of the worst, since 1 plant-prod + 2 tags alone is ~11 MC. COTD (benbever): 'best quantified value after Merger, but only works with a couple of cards'. Score reflects average case across all hands.
Ecology Experts.when_to_pick: Only when you have a strong card with a global requirement you can't meet otherwise. Without target = bad prelude.

New Partner.name: New Partner
New Partner.economy: 1 MC-prod = 5 MC + draw 2 preludes, play 1. Expected extra prelude value = ~20-25 MC (the better of 2 random). No tags. Total ~25-30 MC expected.
New Partner.reasoning: Effective mulligan for preludes. If your other preludes are mediocre, this gives you a shot at something better plus 1 MC-prod. The variance is the issue — you might draw 2 bad preludes. COTD: 'consider this top tier as it is a mulligan with a bonus' (ad_hocNC). Best when other preludes are weak; worst when they're already good.
New Partner.when_to_pick: When your other preludes are mediocre and you want a reroll. Skip if you already have 2 great preludes.

World Government Advisor.name: World Government Advisor
World Government Advisor.economy: 2 TR = ~14 MC immediate. 1 card = 3-4 MC. Earth tag ~2 MC. Action: raise any parameter 1 step each gen = ~7 MC/gen. Total very high if action used every gen.
World Government Advisor.reasoning: Extremely powerful rush prelude with game-warping action. Using the action every gen accelerates game end by 1-2 gens, which benefits the player if they are ahead in TR. The 2 TR + card + Earth tag base is decent. COTD concerns: 'too influential, can end game early' (benbever). Score reflects that the action is double-edged — shortening the game hurts engine builders including yourself.
World Government Advisor.when_to_pick: When you are committed to rushing and want to shorten the game. Dangerous if your opponents are also rushing or if you need engine time.

Corridors of Power.name: Corridors of Power
Corridors of Power.economy: 1 TR = 7 MC, 4 MC immediate, Earth tag ~2 MC. Effect: ~1 card/gen in 3P = ~3 MC/gen for ~7 gens = ~21 MC. Total ~34 MC if effect fires every gen.
Corridors of Power.reasoning: High theoretical value but inconsistent in 3P. Becoming party leader every gen is realistic in 2P but harder in 3P (competition for lobbying). The 1 TR + 4 MC base is mediocre alone. Earth tag is nice. Overall decent but not spectacular — the effect's value is highly variable. Turmoil-dependent.
Corridors of Power.when_to_pick: When playing Turmoil-focused strategy or Septum Tribus. Less reliable in competitive 3P lobbying.

Rise To Power.name: Rise To Power
Rise To Power.economy: 3 MC-prod = 15-18 MC. 3 delegates = ~9 MC (3 MC per delegate). No tags = -3 MC. Total ~21-24 MC.
Rise To Power.reasoning: Decent combo of production + political influence. 3 delegates in separate parties means 3 party leader positions potentially, which gives influence and chairman TR chances. 3 MC-prod is solid. No tags hurts. Turmoil-dependent. In 3P the political value is moderate — others compete for lobbying.
Rise To Power.when_to_pick: When Turmoil matters to your strategy and you want early political control. Less impactful in non-political strategies.

Supplier.name: Supplier
Supplier.economy: 2 energy-prod = 15 MC, 4 steel = 8 MC. Power tag ~1 MC. Total ~24 MC.
Supplier.reasoning: Solid average prelude. 2 energy-prod is useful with Colonies or energy-hungry cards. 4 steel is decent gen 1 spending. Power tag is rarely relevant. COTD: 'generally like it, upper middle tier' (shai_aus). Not exciting but reliable. Slightly worse than Aquifer Turbines (which adds ocean TR).
Supplier.when_to_pick: When you need energy for Colonies or have building cards to spend steel on. Decent default pick.

Focused Organization.name: Focused Organization
Focused Organization.economy: Effect: -1 MC на events/standard projects. ~3-4 MC/gen.
Focused Organization.reasoning: Средний ongoing effect. Зависит от количества standard projects и events.

Power Generation.name: Power Generation
Power Generation.economy: 3 energy-prod = 22.5 MC. Power tag ~1 MC. Total ~23.5 MC. Energy as heat if unused = ~12 MC (3 heat-prod equivalent).
Power Generation.reasoning: Good with Colonies (instant trading capability if you have 3 energy), decent without. 3 energy-prod is a lot — you need sinks (Strip Mine, Electro Catapult) or it becomes expensive heat production. COTD: 'good if you need energy, skippable if not'. Power tag is rarely useful.
Power Generation.when_to_pick: Best with Colonies (can trade gen 1). Also good with energy-hungry cards. Without sinks, it is just expensive heat prod.

Dome Farming.name: Dome Farming
Dome Farming.economy: 2 MC-prod = 10-12 MC, 1 plant-prod = 8 MC. Plant tag ~2 MC, Building tag ~2 MC (Robotic Workforce target). Total ~22-24 MC.
Dome Farming.reasoning: Slightly below average in raw value but the 2 tags are genuinely useful. Building tag makes it a Robotic Workforce target (+10 MC value if copied). Plant tag for NRA, Ecologist. COTD: 'not bad, tags are the most useful thing'. Solid filler but not exciting.
Dome Farming.when_to_pick: When you need the Plant+Building tag combo, or have Robotic Workforce. Acceptable filler prelude.

Mining Operations.name: Mining Operations
Mining Operations.economy: 2 steel-prod = 16 MC, 4 steel = 8 MC. Building tag ~2 MC. Total ~26 MC IF you can spend the steel.
Mining Operations.reasoning: Above average raw value but highly conditional on having building cards. If your hand is space/science-heavy, the steel is nearly worthless. 2 steel-prod is a lot — you need consistent building card flow. COTD: 'feels like overkill' (shai_aus), 'situational' (FieldMouse007). Decent with heavy building strategy.
Mining Operations.when_to_pick: Only when you have 3+ building cards in hand. Without building targets, much weaker.

Terraforming Deal.name: Terraforming Deal
Terraforming Deal.economy: Effect: 1 MC за каждое terraforming другими. ~10-15 MC total в 3P.
Terraforming Deal.reasoning: Пассивный доход от чужого terraforming. В 3P лучше чем в 2P.

Donation.name: Donation
Donation.economy: 21 MC flat. No tags, no production. Average prelude benchmark.
Donation.reasoning: The baseline prelude — exactly average historically but slightly below the current ~24.5 MC average. Raw money is flexible but has no multiplying effect (no production, no tags, no TR). COTD: 'perfectly average, the standard by which others are judged'. Fine with expensive gen 1 cards, underwhelming otherwise.
synergies: Any corp with low starting MC
Donation.when_to_pick: When you have expensive cards to play gen 1 and other preludes don't fit. Never exciting but rarely terrible.

Venus L1 Shade.name: Venus L1 Shade
Venus L1 Shade.economy: 3 Venus steps. Venus TR is ~6-7 MC each (slightly less than temp/O2 due to Venus being less contested). Total = ~18-21 MC. Space tag ~1 MC.
Venus L1 Shade.reasoning: 3 Venus steps is solid TR (3 TR = 21 MC at 7 MC/TR) plus it unlocks Venus requirements (8%, 12%, 16% Venus). Space tag is minor. The issue: Venus TR is less impactful because the Venus track does not end the game and the bonuses at 8%/16% are minor compared to temp/O2 bonuses. No COTD data. Worse than Huge Asteroid (3 temp steps + heat-prod for -5 MC).
Venus L1 Shade.when_to_pick: When you have Venus strategy cards or Morning Star Inc. Without Venus synergy, Huge Asteroid or Great Aquifer are strictly better.

Eccentric Sponsor.name: Eccentric Sponsor
Eccentric Sponsor.economy: Effectively Donation (25 MC) if you have a 25+ MC card. But: no tag, replaces a prelude slot, useless without target. Expected value ~21-25 MC with target, ~0 without.
Eccentric Sponsor.reasoning: High variance prelude. When you have an expensive engine card (Io Mining, Space Elevator, Terraforming Ganymede) in opening hand, it is better than Donation (+4 MC). When you don't, it's one of the worst preludes — literally does nothing useful. COTD: 'either great or useless, usually useless'. No tag is a penalty.
Eccentric Sponsor.when_to_pick: Only when you have a 25+ MC card you want to play gen 1. If you don't have the target, never pick this.

Industrial Complex.name: Industrial Complex
Industrial Complex.economy: Sets all <1 productions to 1. For zero-production corp: +1 steel(8)+1 ti(12.5)+1 plant(8)+1 energy(7.5)+1 heat(4) = ~40 MC theoretical. -18 MC cost. Building tag ~2 MC. But most corps start with SOME production.
Industrial Complex.reasoning: High ceiling but very corp-dependent. With corps that start at all zeros (Credicor, Point Luna), you get massive value. With corps that already have production (Mining Guild, Ecoline), it's terrible — you pay 18 MC for almost nothing. COTD: 'not compatible with corps that give production'. Building tag is nice. Average case ~22-25 MC.
Industrial Complex.when_to_pick: Only with corps that start at 0 production across the board. Never with Ecoline, Mining Guild, Helion, etc.

Old Mining Colony.name: Old Mining Colony
Old Mining Colony.economy: 1 colony = ~13 MC, 1 ti-prod = 12.5 MC, -1 card = -3 MC. Space tag ~1 MC. Total ~23.5 MC.
Old Mining Colony.reasoning: About average value. Colony placement is nice but discarding a card hurts. 1 ti-prod is decent. Space tag is minor. COTD (benbever): 'it is ok, ~23 in quantified value'. Worse than Early Colonization (which gives a trade too) and does not provide energy for future trading.
Old Mining Colony.when_to_pick: When colonies are good and you have a junk card to discard. Early Colonization is generally better.

Recession.name: Recession
Recession.economy: 1 TR + draw 3 cards - discard 1 card. ~17-20 MC.
Recession.reasoning: Below average. TR + card selection = decent но не exciting.
Recession.when_to_pick: Когда нужен TR + card selection. Filler прелюд.

Main Belt Asteroids.name: Main Belt Asteroids
Main Belt Asteroids.economy: -5 MC. Action: add 1 asteroid to any card. Effect: each asteroid on this = 1 ti + 0.5 VP. Self-contained: ~1 ti-prod equivalent. Space tag ~1 MC. Total ~15 MC base + ~3 MC/gen ongoing.
Main Belt Asteroids.reasoning: Slow but steady value. The -5 MC hurts gen 1. Self-contained it's about 1 ti-prod + 0.5 VP/gen which is decent but not exciting. Better with Astrodrill or other asteroid cards. Space tag is minor. COTD (benbever): values it reasonably. Middle-low prelude.
Main Belt Asteroids.when_to_pick: When you have asteroid synergies (Astrodrill). Without synergy, it's below average.

Floating Trade Hub.name: Floating Trade Hub
Floating Trade Hub.economy: 2 floaters/action, convert to standard resource. ~3 MC/gen as titanium (1 ti every 1.5 gens average). Space tag ~1 MC. With other floater cards, value increases.
Floating Trade Hub.reasoning: Slow engine card on a prelude. 2 floaters/action is decent but converting to ti is only ~3 MC/gen. No immediate value — zero MC, zero production gen 1. Space tag is minor. Better with other floater cards to feed. Floater trap concerns apply somewhat, though this is cheaper than most floater cards.
Floating Trade Hub.when_to_pick: When you have floater synergies and other immediate-value preludes covering your gen 1 needs. Alone = weak.

Orbital Construction Yard.name: Orbital Construction Yard
Orbital Construction Yard.economy: 1 ti-prod = 12.5 MC, 4 ti = 12 MC. Space tag ~1 MC. Total ~25.5 MC IF ti is spent. Vulnerable to AMC.
Orbital Construction Yard.reasoning: Average raw value but highly conditional. 4 ti + 1 ti-prod is a lot of titanium — you need space cards to spend it. Vulnerable to Asteroid Mining Consortium stealing the production. COTD: 'not great' (shai_aus), 'below average, often have 2 better options' (benbever). Less flexible than Metal-Rich Asteroid.
Orbital Construction Yard.when_to_pick: When you have multiple space cards in hand. Skip if your hand is building/earth-focused or if AMC risk is high.

Board of Directors.name: Board of Directors
Board of Directors.economy: Effect: рисуй 1 карту когда играешь карту с 2+ requirements. ~2-3 cards/game.
Board of Directors.reasoning: Slow card draw engine. Requirement карт не так много.
Board of Directors.when_to_pick: Только если много requirement карт в руке.

Self-Sufficient Settlement.name: Self-Sufficient Settlement
Self-Sufficient Settlement.economy: 2 MC-prod = 10-12 MC, city tile = ~5-10 MC. Building+City tags ~3 MC. Total ~18-25 MC.
Self-Sufficient Settlement.reasoning: Below average. Cities are overvalued and the 2 MC-prod does not compensate. COTD: 'one of the worst preludes generally' (Krazyguy75), 'meeeh' (shai_aus). Only good on Elysium (Olympus Mons) or Tharsis for Mayor. The Building+City tags have niche value but not enough.
Self-Sufficient Settlement.when_to_pick: Only for Mayor milestone on Tharsis or prime city spot on Elysium. Otherwise skip.

Anti-desertification Techniques.name: Anti-desertification Techniques
Anti-desertification Techniques.economy: 1 plant-prod = 8 MC, 1 steel-prod = 8 MC, 3 MC immediate. 2 tags ~3 MC. Total ~22 MC.
Anti-desertification Techniques.reasoning: Below average value at ~22 MC. The 2 tags (Microbe+Plant) can be useful for Ecologist milestone or Splice, but 1 plant-prod alone is weak — attracts hate without providing enough for conversion. Steel-prod is nice but only 1. Community rates it weak.
Anti-desertification Techniques.when_to_pick: Only when tags matter for your strategy (Ecologist, Splice) and other preludes are worse. Generally skip.

Martian Industries.name: Martian Industries
Martian Industries.economy: 1 energy-prod = 7.5 MC, 1 steel-prod = 8 MC, 6 MC immediate. Building tag ~2 MC. Total ~23.5 MC.
Martian Industries.reasoning: Just barely below average. The production mix is uninspiring — 1 of each doesn't build toward anything specific. The 6 MC immediate helps gen 1 spending. Building tag is fine. COTD: 'nothing offensive but nothing great' (shai_aus). Only good when energy is specifically needed (Colonies, Electro Catapult).
Martian Industries.when_to_pick: When you specifically need energy production for a gen 1 play. Otherwise there are better options.

Mohole.name: Mohole
Mohole.economy: 3 heat-prod = 12 MC (at 4 MC/heat-prod), 3 heat = ~2 MC. Building tag ~2 MC. Total ~16 MC. Heat-prod is the least efficient production.
Mohole.reasoning: Below average. Heat production is overpriced and least efficient in the game. 3 heat-prod sounds impressive but heat is the cheapest resource. COTD (Krazyguy75): 'this prelude sucks'. Building tag is nice for Robotic Workforce. Only good for Helion (heat = MC) or dedicated rush strategies. Polar Industries is better (ocean + heat).
Mohole.when_to_pick: Only as Helion (where heat-prod = MC-prod) or for Robotic Workforce target. Otherwise avoid.

Biolab.name: Biolab
Biolab.economy: 1 plant-prod = 8 MC, 3 random cards = 9-12 MC. Science tag ~3 MC. Total ~20-23 MC.
Biolab.reasoning: Below average value. 1 plant-prod is weak standalone. 3 random cards are a gamble — you might get nothing useful. Science tag is the main draw (unlock requirements, Scientist award). COTD consensus: 'bottom 20% prelude, only playable with bad hand'. Better preludes exist for both production and card draw.
Biolab.when_to_pick: Only when you need the Science tag to unlock something critical in gen 1, or your other preludes are truly terrible.

Early Settlement.name: Early Settlement
Early Settlement.economy: 1 plant-prod = 8 MC, city tile = ~5-10 MC (placement bonus + future adjacency). Building+City tags ~3 MC. Total ~16-21 MC.
Early Settlement.reasoning: Below average. Cities are overvalued by the game — they cost an action and adjacency VP takes many gens to develop. 1 plant-prod alone is weak. Building+City tags are niche. COTD: 'rarely worth picking'. Only decent for Mayor milestone on Tharsis or primo city spot on Elysium.
Early Settlement.when_to_pick: Only on Tharsis for Mayor milestone or if you can grab Olympus Mons on Elysium. Otherwise skip.

Colony Trade Hub.name: Colony Trade Hub
Colony Trade Hub.economy: 1 energy-prod = 7.5 MC, 2 ti = 6 MC, effect +2 MC per colony placed. Need 6 colonies for full value (~12 MC additional). Total ~13 MC base + colony bonus.
Colony Trade Hub.reasoning: Very weak base value (~13 MC). The colony bonus is too slow — need 6+ colonies to reach average prelude value, which rarely happens in 8-9 gen game. Space tag is minor. COTD (benbever): 'only worth ~13 in quantified value'. One of the weakest Prelude 2 cards.
Colony Trade Hub.when_to_pick: Only in 4-5 player games with aggressive colony placement. In 3P, almost never reaches average value.

Giant Solar Collector.name: Giant Solar Collector
Giant Solar Collector.economy: 2 energy-prod = 15 MC, 1 Venus step = ~4-5 MC (Venus TR less valuable). Power+Space tags ~2 MC. Total ~21-22 MC.
Giant Solar Collector.reasoning: Below average. 2 energy-prod is nice for Colonies but the Venus step is less efficient than temp/O2 raises (Venus TR is often wasted). Power+Space tags are rarely useful together. COTD: 'middling to weak with Colonies, terrible without' (Krazyguy75). Supplier is strictly better (same energy, 4 steel > 1 Venus step).
Giant Solar Collector.when_to_pick: Only with Colonies when you need energy for trading and Venus synergy. Otherwise skip.

Mohole Excavation.name: Mohole Excavation
Mohole Excavation.economy: 1 steel-prod = 8 MC, 2 heat-prod = 8 MC, 2 heat = ~1 MC. Building tag ~2 MC. Total ~19 MC.
Mohole Excavation.reasoning: Below average. Unfocused production split between steel and heat is underwhelming. 2 heat-prod is weak. COTD (benbever): 'below average value, not very interesting'. Building tag helps slightly. Strictly worse than Mining Operations (which gives 2 steel-prod + 4 steel instead of 1 steel + 2 heat).
Mohole Excavation.when_to_pick: Almost never. Only as Helion or if you need Building tag and nothing better exists.

Preservation Program.name: Preservation Program
Preservation Program.economy: Effect: add 1 animal/microbe when opponent raises parameter. ~3-5 resources total.
Preservation Program.reasoning: Slow, зависит от opponent actions. Animal/microbe resources слабо конвертируются.

Venus Contract.name: Venus Contract
Venus Contract.economy: Effect: +2 MC за Venus карты. ~4-6 MC total.
Venus Contract.reasoning: Слишком мало Venus карт в средней игре для payoff.
Venus Contract.when_to_pick: Только с Morning Star Inc + Venus heavy hand.

Nobel Prize.name: Nobel Prize
Nobel Prize.economy: 5 MC + 2 VP (= ~10 MC mid-game) + 2 requirement cards (~8 MC from selection) + Wild tag ~2 MC. Total ~25 MC. BUT 2 VP does nothing for gen 1 engine.
Nobel Prize.reasoning: Looks decent on paper but 2 VP on a prelude is terrible — VP does nothing to build your engine early. 5 MC is minimal. The 2 requirement cards are a gamble (might not hit what you need). COTD (icehawk84): 'absolutely horrendous, 2 VP is not something you want in a prelude'. Wild tag is minor consolation.
Nobel Prize.when_to_pick: Almost never. Production preludes are strictly better for gen 1. Only if other options are terrible.

Loan.name: Loan
Loan.economy: 30 MC - 2 MC-prod (= -10 MC gen 1 value). Net ~20 MC. No tags = -3 MC penalty. Total ~17 MC effective.
Loan.reasoning: One of the worst preludes. 30 MC sounds great but -2 MC-prod is brutal in gen 1 — you're cutting into your already thin 20 MC production. COTD (benbever): 'one of the worst preludes in quantified value'. Only justified if the 30 MC enables a game-changing gen 1 play that wouldn't happen otherwise. No tags hurts further.
Loan.when_to_pick: Only when 30 MC enables a critical gen 1 play (e.g., Io Mining) and you have no better production prelude.

Io Research Outpost.name: Io Research Outpost
Io Research Outpost.economy: 1 ti-prod = 12.5 MC, 1 card = 3-4 MC. Jovian+Science tags = ~6 MC. Total ~21-23 MC.
Io Research Outpost.reasoning: Below average. 1 ti-prod + 1 card is underwhelming for a prelude slot. The Jovian+Science double tag is the main attraction but even then the total value is mediocre. COTD: 'one of the worst preludes' (ad_hocNC), 'weak card' (FieldMouse007). Only playable with Saturn Systems or when you need both tags for milestones.
Io Research Outpost.when_to_pick: Only with Saturn Systems or when both Jovian+Science tags are critical for your strategy.

Applied Science.name: Applied Science
Applied Science.economy: 6 science resources on this card. Action: spend 1 science for 1 ti/plant-prod OR spend 4 science for 1 VP each. Without Physics Complex, self-contained value is ~6 ti-prod (slow, 6 actions) or mix of prod+VP.
Applied Science.reasoning: A prelude that gives zero immediate value — no MC, no production, no TR. In gen 1, you get nothing to build your engine. The science resources are only useful with Physics Complex (spend 6 for 12 VP) or as slow prod gain. Wild tag is minor. Production preludes far outperform this.
Applied Science.when_to_pick: Only with Physics Complex in opening hand. Otherwise one of the worst preludes.

Galilean Mining.name: Galilean Mining
Galilean Mining.economy: 2 ti-prod = 25 MC theoretical. -5 MC cost. Jovian tag ~3 MC. Total ~23 MC. BUT ti-prod only pays if you have space cards AND vulnerable to AMC.
Galilean Mining.reasoning: Sounds good on paper (2 ti-prod + Jovian tag) but deeply flawed. The -5 MC cost means it doesn't start paying until gen 3. Ti-prod is useless without Space cards to spend it on, and vulnerable to AMC stealing. COTD: 'pretty bad' (shai_aus), 'one of the worst preludes' (ad_hocNC, icehawk84). Inflexible and risky.
Galilean Mining.when_to_pick: Only with Saturn Systems or when you need Jovian tag for Rim Settler. Otherwise one of the weakest preludes.

Biofuels.name: Biofuels
Biofuels.economy: 1 energy-prod = 7.5 MC, 1 plant-prod = 8 MC, 2 plants = ~3 MC. Microbe tag ~1 MC. Total ~19.5 MC.
Biofuels.reasoning: Well below average value (~19.5 MC vs 24.5 average). Weak production spread, bad tag. COTD consensus: 'pretty bad'. Only marginally useful if you desperately need energy for something and have Ecoline for plant conversion. Bottom 20% of preludes.
Biofuels.when_to_pick: Almost never. Only if you desperately need energy prod and nothing better is available.

Biosphere Support.name: Biosphere Support
Biosphere Support.economy: 2 plant-prod = 16 MC, -1 MC-prod = -5 MC. Plant tag ~2 MC. Total ~13 MC.
Biosphere Support.reasoning: One of the worst preludes. The -1 MC-prod is devastating in gen 1 when you only have ~20 MC production. 2 plant-prod alone rarely justifies losing MC income. COTD top comment: 'it sucks'. The plant tag is its only saving grace for NRA. Dome Farming is strictly better (same tag, better production, no MC loss).
Biosphere Support.when_to_pick: Almost never. Only Ecoline with NRA in hand where you desperately need 3 plant tags. Bottom 5 prelude.

Nitrogen Shipment.name: Nitrogen Shipment
Nitrogen Shipment.economy: 1 plant-prod = 8 MC, 1 TR = 7 MC, 5 MC immediate. No tags = -3 MC. Total ~17 MC.
Nitrogen Shipment.reasoning: One of the worst preludes. A little bit of everything but not enough of anything. No tags makes it even worse. COTD: 'in the contest for worst prelude' (shai_aus), 'average value that is actually not good' (benbever). The production and TR are too spread thin to matter.
Nitrogen Shipment.when_to_pick: Almost never. Only when all other options are truly terrible.

Society Support.name: Society Support
Society Support.economy: 1 plant-prod = 8 MC, 1 energy-prod = 7.5 MC, 1 heat-prod = 4 MC, -1 MC-prod = -5 MC. No tags = -3 MC. Total ~11.5 MC.
Society Support.reasoning: The worst or second-worst prelude in the game. Losing MC-prod in gen 1 is devastating, and you get 3 marginal productions in return with no tags at all. COTD (shai_aus): 'no idea what they were thinking'. The total value (~11.5 MC) is less than half the average prelude. Even the no-tag penalty is insult to injury.
Society Support.when_to_pick: Never. There is virtually no scenario where this is the right pick.

Space Port Colony.name: Space Port Colony
Space Port Colony.economy: 30 MC total (27+3) for colony + double colony + trade fleet + VP/2 colonies (~3-5 VP in 3P). Ti payable. Req: 1 colony. Combined value easily 60-90 MC.
Space Port Colony.reasoning: Arguably the strongest card in the entire game per Krazyguy75 ('top 3 card'). Double colony + trade fleet is game-breaking value. VP/2 colonies provides 3-5 VP in 3P for free. benbever writes extensive analysis confirming absurd value. Every COTD commenter rates it S-tier or higher. 'All double colony cards are broken.'
Space Port Colony.when_to_pick: Always draft, always play. One of the 3 best cards in the game with colonies.

Research Colony.name: Research Colony
Research Colony.economy: 23 MC total (20+3) for colony + 2 cards (~8 MC) + Science+Space tags (~5 MC). Colony SP costs 17, so extra 6 MC for cards+tags+double colony. Ti payable.
Research Colony.reasoning: One of the strongest cards in the game. Double colony ability is game-breaking. On Luna/Ceres/Pluto, a second colony doubles trade income. benbever, Krazyguy75, and community unanimously call it a top-tier card. 'Instadraft, instabuy' per COTD. No requirements, ti payable, absurd value.
Research Colony.when_to_pick: Always draft, always buy. Play ASAP to maximize double colony value. One of the best cards in the entire game.

Sky Docks.name: Sky Docks
Sky Docks.economy: 21 MC total (18+3) for extra trade fleet (~10+ MC/gen) + -1 MC/card discount (~2-3 MC/gen) + 2 VP (~10 MC) + Space+Earth tags (~4 MC). Ti payable. Req: 2 Earth tags.
Sky Docks.reasoning: One of the best cards in the game. benbever writes extensive analysis showing it outvalues Earth Catapult. Extra trade fleet is game-breaking with good colonies. -1 MC discount on ALL cards compounds heavily. 2 VP provides floor value. Community calls it 'S+' and 'Earth Cat of Colonies.' 2 Earth tag requirement is mild with preludes.
Sky Docks.when_to_pick: Always draft. Play ASAP when 2 Earth tags met. Top 5 card in colony games.

Nitrogen-Rich Asteroid.name: Nitrogen-Rich Asteroid
Nitrogen-Rich Asteroid.economy: Cost 31+3=34 MC (ti payable). Without 3 plant tags: 2 TR (14.8) + 1 temp (10) + 1 plant-prod (8). Total ~33. With 3 plant tags: +4 plant-prod instead = 32 MC plant-prod. Total ~57 MC.
Nitrogen-Rich Asteroid.reasoning: One of the most powerful cards in the game when played with 3 plant tags. 4 plant production + 3 TR is game-winning if played gen 1-3. shai_aus's sarcastic 'absolutely terrible' comment (42 upvotes) reveals community consensus that this is S-tier. Even without 3 plant tags it's decent. With Ecoline/NRA enablers, it dominates. The Space tag makes it ti-payable.
Nitrogen-Rich Asteroid.when_to_pick: Always draft. With 2+ plant tags, start planning to meet the 3-tag threshold. Without plant tags, still decent for TR+temp+plant-prod.

Research Outpost.name: Research Outpost
Research Outpost.economy: 21 MC total (18+3) for city (~14 MC) + -1 MC discount (~2-3 MC/gen for 6-7 gens = 15+ MC) + Science+City+Building tags (~6 MC). Steel payable. Total value ~35+ MC.
Research Outpost.reasoning: Best city in the game per community consensus. No energy requirement, steel payable, -1 MC/card discount is massive over a full game, and triple tags (Science+City+Building) are incredible. shai_aus, ad_hocNC, and benbever all rate it among the best cards. Play gen 1 when possible. benbever calculates 32+ MC value if played gen 1.
Research Outpost.when_to_pick: Always draft, play gen 1 if possible. Late game placement becomes impossible. Top 5 engine card.

Earth Catapult.name: Earth Catapult
Earth Catapult.economy: 23 MC + 3 MC card = 26 MC cost. Effect: -2 MC per card played. With 13+ cards played: 26+ MC saved = break even + 2 VP. Typically 8-12 cards after playing this = 16-24 MC saved + 2 VP (~10 MC).
Earth Catapult.reasoning: Strong contender for best project card in the game. Per icehawk84, if gotten early-to-mid game, you stop whatever you're doing to play it. The 2 MC discount on every card compounds massively with card draw engines. The 2 VP and Earth tag add significant value. Per benbever, great with Credicor, Vitor, and Earth Office. Only weakness: expensive to deploy and needs card flow to maximize.
Earth Catapult.when_to_pick: Almost always in gen 1-4. Even gen 5 can be worth it with strong card draw. Top 3 draft priority.

Mars University.name: Mars University
Mars University.economy: Cost 8+3=11 MC (steel payable). Value: 1 VP (5) + Science tag (3-5) + Building tag (1-2) + card cycling (~2 MC per science tag played). After 3-4 science tags = 6-8 MC from cycling.
Mars University.reasoning: One of the best cards in the game. Cheap, no requirements, incredible tags (Science+Building), 1 VP, and the card cycling effect is a true engine enabler. COTD experts nearly unanimously rate it top 5. The ability to swap bad cards for new ones compounds over the game. Even ad_hocNC, who is skeptical of engines, acknowledges its potency.
Mars University.when_to_pick: Always. First-pick caliber in most drafts. Play as early as possible to maximize cycling value.

Solar Logistics.name: Solar Logistics
Solar Logistics.economy: 23 MC total (20+3) - 6 MC (2 titanium) = effective 17 MC for card draw on ALL space events + -2 MC Earth discount + 1 VP + Earth+Space tags. Broken-level value.
Solar Logistics.reasoning: Extremely powerful card that COTD nearly unanimously calls overpowered. Draws cards when ANY player plays space events (not just you). icehawk84 says 'powerful, could discourage opponents from space events.' FieldMouse007 sarcastically notes 'terrible card design' (meaning OP). Some playgroups remove the VP and titanium and it is still a priority card. Nearly S-tier but 20 MC cost keeps it at high A.
Solar Logistics.when_to_pick: Always draft early-mid game. The card draw from ALL players' space events is absurd value.

Kelp Farming.name: Kelp Farming
Kelp Farming.economy: 17 MC + 3 MC card = 20 MC for 2 MC-prod (~10 MC) + 3 plant-prod (~24 MC) + 2 plants (~2 MC) + 1 VP (~5 MC) = ~41 MC value. Requires 6 oceans. Insane value when playable.
Kelp Farming.reasoning: One of the best cards in the entire game. At 20 MC for 41 MC of value, the efficiency is staggering. The 6 ocean requirement can be met as early as gen 1-2 with aggressive ocean play. 3 plant production translates to ~2-3 extra greeneries over remaining gens. The MC production, plants, VP, and Plant tag all add up. Game-defining card that shapes ocean strategy.
Kelp Farming.when_to_pick: Always keep from opening hand. Top draft priority. Worth pushing oceans to enable. One of the top 5 plant cards.

Insects.name: Insects
Insects.economy: 9 MC + 3 MC card = 12 MC. Gain 1 plant prod per plant tag. With 3-4 plant tags = 3-4 plant prod (~24-32 MC). With 5+ tags = game-changing. 6% oxygen requirement. Microbe tag bonus.
Insects.reasoning: One of the best cards in the game for plant strategies. At just 12 MC it can easily generate 3+ plant production, translating to 2-3 extra greeneries over remaining generations. Game-defining card that makes all plant tags more valuable. The 6% oxygen requirement is manageable by mid-game. Weaker with all expansions diluting plant tags but still excellent.
Insects.when_to_pick: Always high draft priority. Keep from opening hand with ANY plant tags. Even hate-draft to deny plant players. Top 10 card in base+prelude.

Spin-off Department.name: Spin-off Department
Spin-off Department.economy: 13 MC total (10+3) for 2 MC-prod (~10 MC) + card draw on every 20+ MC card played. Building tag, steel payable. Effectively 3-4 MC for the draw effect alone.
Spin-off Department.reasoning: icehawk84 says 'on par with Mars University.' Subtracting Sponsors' cost (9 MC for 2 MC-prod), the card draw effect costs only ~4 MC. With ~62 cards costing 20+ MC in the full deck, engine players trigger this 3-5 times per game. COTD unanimously rates it very highly. Building tag + steel payable makes it easy to play. One of the best engine cards in Colonies.
Spin-off Department.when_to_pick: Always draft early. Play gen 1-2 for maximum draw value. Never pass in draft.

Olympus Conference.name: Olympus Conference
Olympus Conference.economy: Cost 10+3=13 MC (steel payable). Value: 1 VP (5) + Science+Earth+Building tags (6-10) + free card every 2 science tags. After 4 science tags = 2 free cards (6-8 MC).
Olympus Conference.reasoning: Incredible triple-tag card with card draw engine. Not quite Mars University (which swaps every science tag vs every other), but the Earth+Building+Science tags make it arguably better in some dimensions. shai_aus gives it 30 upvotes calling it amazing. Steel-payable, no requirements, 1 VP. One of the best engine cards in the game.
Olympus Conference.when_to_pick: Always. High first-pick priority. Play early to maximize card draw. The triple-tag is unmatched.

Giant Ice Asteroid.name: Giant Ice Asteroid
Giant Ice Asteroid.economy: 36 MC (ti payable) + 3 MC card = 39 MC cost. Returns: 2 TR temp (~14.4 MC) + 2 oceans (2 TR ~14.4 MC + 2 placement bonuses ~6 MC) + plant attack. Total ~35+ MC in TR + bonuses. Space+Event tags.
Giant Ice Asteroid.reasoning: One of the best space events — massively efficient terraforming in a single action. 4 TR for 39 MC = 9.75 MC per TR, which is good value. The 2 oceans provide placement bonuses and trigger ocean requirements. Ti payable with Phobolog makes this absurdly efficient. The plant attack is a bonus (take-that penalty applies in 3P but it's not the core value). Per community, this is a top-tier event card.
Giant Ice Asteroid.when_to_pick: Almost always when seen. Especially powerful when ocean placement bonuses and temperature bonuses are available.

L1 Trade Terminal.name: L1 Trade Terminal
L1 Trade Terminal.economy: 25 MC + 3 MC card = 28 MC. Space tag, 2 VP. Effect: +2 colony track steps per trade = +6-8 MC value per trade. Over 5+ trades = 30-40 MC+ value. Also adds resources to 3 different cards.
L1 Trade Terminal.reasoning: Extremely powerful colony synergy card that generates massive recurring value. Each trade gives +2 track steps worth 6-8 MC, and with a second trade fleet this doubles. Even over 3-4 trades the card pays for itself. The 2 VP and resource placement are gravy. Space tag for titanium payment. One of the strongest Prelude 2 additions.
L1 Trade Terminal.when_to_pick: Always keep in opening hand. Top draft priority in Colony games. The earlier you play this, the more value it generates.

Protected Habitats.name: Protected Habitats
Protected Habitats.economy: 8 MC total (5+3) for protection of all plants, animals, microbes. Blocks Virus (4 plant swing), asteroids (3-6 plants), Predators, Ants. Effective value easily 10-20+ MC over a game.
Protected Habitats.reasoning: Cheap, easy to play, and extremely impactful. icehawk84 calls it S-tier. In 3P, it redirects all plant attacks to opponents, which is a double benefit. No tags is a downside, but the protection value is enormous for any plant-based strategy. shai_aus and FieldMouse007 both rate it very highly. Slightly below S because in all-expansion format attack density is lower.
Protected Habitats.when_to_pick: Almost always draft - deny it to opponents even if you don't need it. Play when you have plants/animals worth protecting.

Cutting Edge Technology.name: Cutting Edge Technology
Cutting Edge Technology.economy: -2 MC за requirement карты + 1 VP. Топ engine карта.
Cutting Edge Technology.reasoning: Универсальный дискаунт на req карты. 1 VP бонусом. Science тег ценный.
Cutting Edge Technology.when_to_pick: Всегда хорош если есть 2+ req карт в руке.

Ecological Zone.name: Ecological Zone
Ecological Zone.economy: 12 MC + 3 MC card = 15 MC cost. Returns: tile placement (~4-6 MC), starts with 1 animal (counts own 2 tags), Plant+Animal tags (~3 MC). Typically accumulates 3-4 VP = 15-20 MC. With bio combos: 5+ VP.
Ecological Zone.reasoning: One of the best combo cards in the game. Per shai_aus, it's a vital part of the 'holy Plant Trinity' with Viral Enhancers and Decomposers. Per ad_hocNC, it's the best point card in base game. The dual Plant+Animal tags are incredible for milestones (Ecologist, NRA) and trigger both bio-tag accumulator chains. The tile placement adds additional value. Easily 3-4 VP even without heavy combos.
Ecological Zone.when_to_pick: High priority whenever you have or plan for a greenery. Core card for bio-tag strategies. Hate-draft from plant players.

AI Central.name: AI Central
AI Central.economy: 21+3=24 MC + ~7 MC energy-prod = 31 MC effective. Action: draw 2 cards/gen = 6-8 MC value/gen. 1 VP = 5 MC. Payoff in ~4 gens. Science+Building tags worth ~4 MC.
AI Central.reasoning: One of the strongest card-draw engines in the game. 2 free cards per gen is enormous value for engine players. However, as COTD commenters note, it is somewhat overrated -- it needs 3 Science tags, energy production, and a strong economy to play the drawn cards. Played gen 3-4 with good economy it is top-tier; gen 6+ it is mediocre. The high setup cost means it is not always playable.
AI Central.when_to_pick: When you already have 2+ Science tags and energy production, and expect a longer game. Counter-draft to deny engine players.

Deimos Down.name: Deimos Down
Deimos Down.economy: 31 MC (ti payable) + 3 MC card = 34 MC cost. Returns: 3 TR (~21.6 MC) + 4 steel (~8 MC) + plant attack (~8 MC value in 3P, less due to take-that). Effective cost vs 3 SP asteroids: 34 vs 42 MC.
Deimos Down.reasoning: One of the best space events in the game. 3 temperature raises for 34 MC is significantly cheaper than standard projects. The 4 steel returned partially offsets the cost. Plant removal is a bonus (take-that penalty mitigated because the core value is in terraforming, not the attack). Ti payable makes it even more efficient. Per shai_aus and ad_hocNC, it's a top 10 base game card.
Deimos Down.when_to_pick: Almost always when seen. Best early for heat production bonuses, but good at any point for efficient temperature rushing.

Earth Office.name: Earth Office
Earth Office.economy: 1 MC + 3 MC card = 4 MC cost. Effect: -3 MC per Earth tag played. Pays for itself in 2 Earth tags. With 4-6 Earth tags: 12-18 MC saved = huge profit.
Earth Office.reasoning: Underpriced card that easily pays for itself. Per icehawk84, it's ridiculously strong for Point Luna and Teractor. Per FieldMouse007, it pays for itself in 2 Earth tags and everything after is pure profit. The Earth tag itself counts toward other Earth synergies. At 4 MC total cost, the risk of picking it up is minimal even if you only play 2-3 more Earth tags.
Earth Office.when_to_pick: Almost always pick early. Even as speculation on future Earth tags, the cost is trivially low.

Large Convoy.name: Large Convoy
Large Convoy.economy: 36 MC + 3 MC card = 39 MC. 2 VP + ocean (TR + bonus ~9 MC) + 2 cards (~6 MC) + 5 plants or 4 animals on 1VP animal (2-4 VP = 10-20 MC). Full value with 1VP animal: ~45-55 MC value. Ti-payable, heavy discounts.
Large Convoy.reasoning: Premier late-game point bomb, especially with a 1VP animal card. The Earth+Space event tags enable massive discounts making the high cost manageable. With a 1VP animal, the 4 animals = 4 VP making the total output 7+ VP plus cards and ocean. Even the plant mode is reasonable mid-game with oxygen not maxed. High draft priority card that shapes strategy.
Large Convoy.when_to_pick: Keep from opening hand if you expect to find 1VP animal. High draft priority. Excellent last-gen titanium dump.

Psychrophiles.name: Psychrophiles
Psychrophiles.economy: 5 MC total (2+3) for effectively ~2 MC/gen discount on plant cards + Microbe tag + stall action. icehawk84 calls it 'most impactful card under 5 MC.'
Psychrophiles.reasoning: Extremely cheap and high value. Acts as ~2 MC production specifically for plant cards, which are common in any strategy. Max -20C requirement ensures early game play only. Microbe tag adds Ecologist/Decomposers synergy. Universally praised in COTD. One of the best low-cost cards in the game.
Psychrophiles.when_to_pick: Always draft if temp <= -20C. Play immediately. Loses value rapidly as temperature rises.

Viral Enhancers.name: Viral Enhancers
Viral Enhancers.economy: 9+3=12 MC for effect: +1 plant or +1 resource per bio tag played. Science+Microbe tags (~5-7 MC). With 5 bio tags after: ~5 plants (10 MC) + 2-3 animal VP (10-15 MC). Science tag bonus.
Viral Enhancers.reasoning: icehawk84 says 'S tier card.' shai_aus says 'one of the best combo cards.' benbever details how just 3 bio tags + 1 animal card already pays it back. The Science+Microbe dual tag is excellent. Every plant/animal/microbe tag gives value. Even moderate bio play yields great returns. Only skip if completely non-bio strategy.
Viral Enhancers.when_to_pick: Almost always. Draft priority. Science tag alone justifies early play. Effect compounds beautifully with bio engine.

Anti-Gravity Technology.name: Anti-Gravity Technology
Anti-Gravity Technology.economy: 14+3=17 MC for 3 VP (15 MC) + Science tag (3-5 MC) + -2 MC discount on all cards (massive in engine). Even without discount, 3VP for 17 MC = excellent.
Anti-Gravity Technology.reasoning: Objectively one of the best cards if you can play it. 3 VP for 17 MC is already strong, and the -2 MC discount is game-changing for engine players. The 7 Science tag requirement is the main barrier -- in all-expansion 3P games it is more achievable than in base game. However, as COTD notes, getting to 7 Science tags AND having AGT in hand at the right time is rare. When it works, it is S-tier. The difficulty drops it to A.
Anti-Gravity Technology.when_to_pick: Always keep if you see it. Even if you cannot play it, counter-draft to deny the science player.

Conscription.name: Conscription
Conscription.economy: 5+3=8 MC cost. -16 MC discount on next card. Net: +8 MC gain - 1 VP (5 MC late-game). Net +3-8 MC depending on timing. Earth tag (2-3 MC) adds value.
Conscription.reasoning: Like Indentured Workers on steroids. Net 8 MC for -1 VP is excellent early-mid game (8 MC >> 1 VP in gens 1-5). The Earth tag adds synergy with Point Luna, Earth Office, Teractor. The 2 Earth tag requirement is achievable with preludes and corporations. Even late game, enabling a 16+ MC card for cheap has significant value. The -1 VP is negligible when the discount enables a powerful play. One of the best discount events.
Conscription.when_to_pick: When you have 2 Earth tags and a 16+ MC card to play. Almost always worth it gens 1-6.

Deimos Down:promo.name: Deimos Down:promo
