Strip Mine.reasoning: Powerful production card but only when played gen 1 with preludes/cards providing energy. benbever warns it's overrated - only very good gen 1 without needing SP energy. IC loves it as a steel sink. With colonies, energy is more valuable, making the -2 energy cost worse. Solid in the right scenario, bad otherwise.
Strip Mine.when_to_pick: Gen 1 only when you already have 2+ energy production from preludes/corp. Skip if you'd need SP power plant.

Zeppelins.name: Zeppelins
Zeppelins.economy: 13+3=16 MC for N MC-prod (where N = cities on Mars) + 1 VP (5 MC). No tags penalty (-3 to -5). In 3P with 4 cities: 4 MC-prod (20 MC) + VP. Great Banker swing.
Zeppelins.reasoning: Zeppelins is the premier Banker award swing card. benbever frequently compares it to Toll Station. In 3P mid-late game with 3-5 cities on Mars, the MC-prod can be 3-5. The 1 VP helps. No tags is a real penalty though. Req 5% O2 limits early play. Primarily a Banker/milestone card.
Zeppelins.when_to_pick: Mid-late game when cities are accumulating. Key Banker award swing. Less useful if Banker isn't in play.

Productive Outpost.name: Productive Outpost
Productive Outpost.reasoning: Free production from colonies. Зависит от количества колоний.

Rover Construction.name: Rover Construction
Rover Construction.economy: +2 MC per city. Steel dump + VP.
Rover Construction.reasoning: Ongoing city bonus. Steel payable. 1 VP.

Asteroid Mining Consortium.name: Asteroid Mining Consortium
Asteroid Mining Consortium.economy: 13+3=16 MC for 1 ti-prod net (12.5 MC) + 1 VP (5 MC) + Jovian tag (3-5 MC). Value ~20-22 MC. Take-that in 3P: -5 penalty. Net ~15-17 MC.
Asteroid Mining Consortium.reasoning: Strong in 2P but significantly weakened in 3P due to take-that pattern -- stealing ti-prod from one player benefits the third player free. The Jovian tag and VP are valuable, and 16 MC for net ti-prod + VP + Jovian is decent. However, the requirement (you need ti-prod) limits when you can play it. In 3P, the take-that penalty drops it from B to C tier. Devastating early against Phobolog/Saturn Systems.
Asteroid Mining Consortium.when_to_pick: Gen 1-2 when you have ti-prod and can target a key opponent. Late game for Jovian tag. Counter-draft to protect your ti-prod.

Dirigibles.name: Dirigibles
Dirigibles.economy: 11 MC + 3 MC card = 14 MC cost. Action: 1 floater to ANY card + floaters worth 3 MC for Venus cards. Equivalent to ~3 MC-prod for Venus spending = ~15 MC over 5 gens. Venus tag for Venuphile.
Dirigibles.reasoning: The best floater dispenser for Venus strategies. The 'to ANY card' clause is key — floaters can go to Aerial Mappers (half a card), Deuterium Export (energy prod), or VP cards. Per benbever, equivalent to ~3 MC-prod but restricted to Venus cards when used on itself. The Venus tag helps with Venuphile and Hoverlord. Decent but not amazing unless you have strong floater targets.
Dirigibles.when_to_pick: When committing to Venus strategy with other floater/Venus cards. Good for Hoverlord milestone.

Giant Solar Shade.name: Giant Solar Shade
Giant Solar Shade.economy: 27 MC (ti payable) + 3 MC card = 30 MC cost. Returns: 3 Venus TR (~21.6 MC over game). Space+Venus tags (~4 MC). Total ~25.6 MC. Value improves if played early for income.
Giant Solar Shade.reasoning: The most direct way to raise Venus 3 steps. At 30 MC for 3 Venus TR, it's 10 MC per TR which is acceptable but not great. Ti payability helps significantly. Per benbever's analysis, in an 8-gen game starting gen 1: 3 VP + 21 MC income = net cost only 9 MC. Per Krazyguy75, Venus steps are overvalued by the game. Best when Venus synergies exist (Aphrodite +3 MC/raise, Terraforming Deal, Venus requirements).
Giant Solar Shade.when_to_pick: Gen 1-3 with titanium and Venus synergies. Less good late game when TR income is minimal.

Investment Loan.name: Investment Loan
Investment Loan.economy: 3 MC + 3 MC card = 6 MC cost. Gain 10 MC. -1 MC prod (~5 MC gen 1). Net: +4 MC immediate minus ongoing production loss. Earth tag. Event tag.
Investment Loan.reasoning: Strong tempo card when you have something urgent to spend the 10 MC on. The -1 MC-prod is a real cost but in 8-gen games with WGT, it's often worth the immediate cash injection. Earth tag provides synergy with Teractor, Point Luna, etc. With event rebates the deal improves significantly. Gets passed too often in draft according to experienced players.
Investment Loan.when_to_pick: When you need 10 MC now to play a key card a generation earlier. Better mid-late game when -1 MC-prod matters less. Great with event rebates.

Mining Rights.name: Mining Rights
Mining Rights.economy: Cost 9+3=12 MC (steel payable). Value: 1 steel/ti-prod (8-12.5) + placement bonus (2-5) + Building tag (1-2). Total ~11-20 MC. Net -1 to +8 MC.
Mining Rights.reasoning: Similar to Mining Area but doesn't require adjacency to your own tile -- just placement on a mineral spot. This gives flexibility and 'teleportation' value for spreading across the map. On titanium spots it's good value. shai_aus rates it great for Mining Guild, ok for others. The 5 MC premium over Mining Area is the teleport flexibility.
Mining Rights.when_to_pick: Gen 1-3 on a titanium spot. Decent for teleporting across the map. Less valuable after gen 3.

Titan Shuttles.name: Titan Shuttles
Titan Shuttles.economy: 23+3=26 MC for Jovian+Space tags + 1 VP + action: add 2 floaters to any Jovian or convert floaters to titanium. Effectively ~1-2 ti-prod over time. With floater support: much more.
Titan Shuttles.reasoning: Complex card. On its own, it's roughly 1 ti-prod on average (cash out every other gen) for 26 MC, which is poor. But the floater flexibility is real: feed other Jovian floater cards, claim Hoverlord, or bank large ti dumps for Unity gens. icehawk84 says 'not great on its own because you pay a premium for the tag.' Needs Jovian/floater support.
Titan Shuttles.when_to_pick: In Jovian strategies with floater synergies. The Jovian tag + Space tag combo helps multipliers and Rim Settler.

Soil Studies.name: Soil Studies
Soil Studies.economy: Cheap greenery при 8+ plants. Triple tag.
Soil Studies.reasoning: 3 тега за дёшево + greenery bonus. Req 8 plants.

Acquired Company.name: Acquired Company
Acquired Company.economy: 10+3=13 MC for 3 MC-prod = 4.33 MC/prod. Good rate. Earth tag worth 2-3 MC. Gen 1 play: 15 MC return by gen 6. Break-even gen 5.
Acquired Company.reasoning: Solid early-game economy card with a valuable Earth tag. At 4.33 MC per MC-prod, it is above average efficiency. The Earth tag adds significant synergy value with Point Luna, Teractor, Earth Office, Cartel. However, it becomes unplayable after gen 3 in 3P/WGT games (~8-9 gens). Strictly an early game card with good tag value.
Acquired Company.when_to_pick: Gen 1-2 with Earth tag synergies or when Banker award is contested. Skip after gen 3 unless Earth tags matter.

Bactoviral Research.name: Bactoviral Research
Bactoviral Research.economy: 10+3=13 MC for 1 card (3-4 MC) + Microbe tag (1-2 MC) + Science tag (3-5 MC) + N microbes where N = science tags. With 6 tags: 6 microbes = 3 VP on Ants or 18 MC on Sulphur-Eating Bacteria.
Bactoviral Research.reasoning: Highly situational but potentially excellent in the right setup. With 6+ Science tags and Ants or Sulphur-Eating Bacteria, this generates 3+ VP or 18+ MC for just 13 MC. The dual Science/Microbe tag is useful. However, without a good microbe dump target, the microbes have little value. The Science tag + card draw make it at least acceptable for engine players. Great ceiling, mediocre floor.
Bactoviral Research.when_to_pick: When you have 4+ Science tags AND a strong microbe dump (Ants, SEB, Decomposers). Otherwise low priority.

Convoy From Europa.name: Convoy From Europa
Convoy From Europa.economy: 15+3=18 MC for 1 ocean TR (7 MC) + placement bonus (~2-4 MC) + 1 card (3-4 MC) + Space/Event tags. Net cost ~5-8 MC for 1 ocean. Ti-payable.
Convoy From Europa.reasoning: Same cost as SP ocean but with a free card and event/space tag synergies. Ti-payable is the main draw. With Optimal Aerobraking and ti payment, the effective cost becomes very low. Without discounts, it is merely an SP ocean with a card -- acceptable but not exciting. Consistently playable in terraform strategies. A reliable but unspectacular space event.
Convoy From Europa.when_to_pick: When you need an ocean and have titanium. Better with event/space rebates. Medium draft priority.

Dawn City.name: Dawn City
Dawn City.economy: 15 MC (3 MC + ~5 ti) + 3 MC card + ~7 MC energy prod = ~25 MC effective. Returns: 3 VP (~15 MC late), 1 ti-prod (~12.5 MC gen1 but usually played late), city tile, Space+City tags (~3 MC).
Dawn City.reasoning: A solid 3 VP dump card for science engines. The 4 science tag requirement means it's almost always played late game where ti-prod is nearly worthless. As benbever notes, at 18 MC effective cost (with ti payment), 3 VP for ~6 MC/VP is decent for a last-gen play. The Space tag allows ti payment which helps a lot.
Dawn City.when_to_pick: Late game with 4+ science tags and excess energy production. Good last-gen titanium dump.

Envoys From Venus.name: Envoys From Venus
Envoys From Venus.economy: 1 MC + 3 MC card = 4 MC cost. Returns: 2 delegates (~10 MC value). Net profit ~6 MC. Requires 3 Venus tags. Venus tag (event).
Envoys From Venus.reasoning: Extremely cost-efficient if you meet the requirement — 4 MC for 2 delegates is great value. The 3 Venus tag requirement is the real gate. In a Venus-heavy engine with Morning Star Inc this is easy to meet. The delegates can snipe Chairman or force a favorable ruling. Event tag has minor value for Legend/Media Group. Already evaluated at 66 in existing data — consistent with that assessment.
Envoys From Venus.when_to_pick: Mid-late game with 3+ Venus tags. Very efficient but highly conditional.

Farming.name: Farming
Farming.economy: 16 MC + 3 MC card = 19 MC cost. Returns: 2 MC-prod (worth very little late), 2 plant-prod (worth ~6 MC last gen as 4 plants), 2 plants (~4 MC), 2 VP (~10 MC late), Plant tag (~2 MC). Total ~22 MC last gen.
Farming.reasoning: Good value but locked behind a +4°C requirement that usually means last generation play. In last gen: 4 plants (possible half greenery = 1-2 VP) + 2 VP for 19 MC is decent. With Ecology Experts prelude it's incredible in gen 1. Per benbever's analysis, it's a good last-gen steel/MC dump. The Plant tag enables NRA and triggers bio synergies. Temperature being the last parameter often makes this playable only on the final turn.
Farming.when_to_pick: Keep in hand from early game, play last generation. Exceptional with Ecology Experts prelude.

Galilean Waystation.name: Galilean Waystation
Galilean Waystation.economy: 15 MC + 3 MC card = 18 MC cost. Returns: X MC-prod where X = Jovian tags in play (all players) + 1 VP. Typically 2-3 MC-prod (~10-15 MC gen1) + 1 VP (~5 MC). Jovian+Space tags (~6 MC). Total ~21-26 MC.
Galilean Waystation.reasoning: Solid Jovian support card that benefits from all players' Jovian tags. In 3P with all expansions, typically 2-3 Jovian tags in play by mid-game for 2-3 MC-prod. The Jovian+Space dual tag is excellent for Rim Settler and Jovian multipliers. The 1 VP is a nice bonus. Per COTD, it's reliable but not exciting — the production scales but rarely spectacularly in 3P where Jovian tags are spread thin.
Galilean Waystation.when_to_pick: Mid game with 3+ total Jovian tags in play. Good for Jovian tag collection strategies.

Industrial Microbes.name: Industrial Microbes
Industrial Microbes.economy: 12 MC + 3 MC card = 15 MC for 1 steel prod (~8 MC) + 1 energy prod (~7.5 MC) = 15.5 MC value. Microbe+Building tags. Fair price gen 1. Steel payable.
Industrial Microbes.reasoning: Fairly priced production card that combines Mine + Power Plant into one card with a bonus Microbe tag. Solid gen 1 play when you need both productions. The Microbe tag is useful for Ecologist milestone and bio synergies. Steel prod loses value fast after gen 1. Better with Rego Plastics/Advanced Alloys. Good for Electro Catapult combo.
Industrial Microbes.when_to_pick: Gen 1-2 when you need energy production and have steel to spend. Good Electro Catapult enabler.

Methane From Titan.name: Methane From Titan
Methane From Titan.economy: Cost 28+3=31 MC (ti payable). Value: 2 heat-prod (8) + 2 plant-prod (16) + 2 VP (10) + Jovian+Space tags (4-7). Total ~38-41 MC. But anti-synergy: heat/plants want rush, Jovian wants engine.
Methane From Titan.reasoning: Good value on paper but internally conflicted. Plant+heat production wants early game rush; Jovian tag + VP want long engine games. Futuralis's top comment (30 upvotes) nails this anti-synergy. Best played gen 1-2 with Inventrix or Smelting Plant prelude, but the 2% O2 req often prevents that. Overpriced for late game.
Methane From Titan.when_to_pick: Gen 1-2 when O2 is already 2%+ and you have titanium. Don't draft for Jovian tag alone -- too expensive.

Peroxide Power.name: Peroxide Power
Peroxide Power.economy: Cost 7+3=10 MC (steel payable) + 1 MC-prod lost (5-6). Total ~16 MC gen 1. Value: 2 energy-prod (15) + Power+Building tags (2-3). Total ~17-18 MC. Net ~+1-2.
Peroxide Power.reasoning: Good energy source when you need it. The -1 MC-prod is less painful than Nuclear Power's -2. Power+Building tags are useful for milestones. shai_aus prefers it over Nuclear Power. Cheap enough to play mid-game. With colonies it's excellent for enabling trading. Not exciting but functional.
Peroxide Power.when_to_pick: When you need 2 energy production. One of the more efficient energy cards. Good with steel payment.

Protected Valley.name: Protected Valley
Protected Valley.economy: 26 MC total (23+3) for greenery + 1 TR + 2 MC-prod + Plant+Building tags. Value: ~14 MC (greenery) + 10 MC (2 MC-prod) + 3 MC (tags) = ~27 MC. Near break-even at full price, good with steel.
Protected Valley.reasoning: Expensive greenery that becomes good with steel payment. No requirements makes it flexible. Plant tag enables NRA. The 2 MC-prod helps if played early-mid. Best as a steel dump. COTD consensus: decent but not exciting, needs steel to be worthwhile.
Protected Valley.when_to_pick: When you have significant steel production or reserves. Good for surprise Gardener milestone claims.

Solar Reflectors.name: Solar Reflectors
Solar Reflectors.economy: 26 MC total (23+3) for 5 heat prod (~20-30 MC depending on gen). Ti payable. Space tag. 5.2 MC per heat prod = good rate. Smaller, better-priced Soletta.
Solar Reflectors.reasoning: Best heat production card by MC/prod ratio after Mohole Area per benbever. Gen 1 play enables fast temperature control and ~5 TR over the game. However, 26 MC on heat production is a huge investment that locks you into rushing. Krazyguy75 argues heat is still overvalued. Much better than Soletta. Gen 1-2 play only.
Solar Reflectors.when_to_pick: Gen 1 with titanium to pay. Enables temperature rush strategy. Worthless after gen 2-3.

Space Station.name: Space Station
Space Station.economy: 13 MC total (10+3) for -2 MC/space card discount + 1 VP (~5 MC) + Space tag. Need 4+ space cards after playing to break even on the discount portion.
Space Station.reasoning: Solid for space-heavy engines but takes many cards to pay off. shai_aus is skeptical, noting opportunity cost is high. COTD split: engine players love it, rushers hate it. Better than Shuttles (no requirement, no energy cost) but worse than Research Outpost (universal discount). 1 VP provides floor value. Ti payable for the cost.
Space Station.when_to_pick: Early-mid game when planning many space cards. Late game only for VP dump with titanium.

Titan Floating Launch-pad.name: Titan Floating Launch-pad
Titan Floating Launch-pad.economy: 18+3=21 MC for Jovian tag + 1 VP + 2 floaters immediate + action: add 1 floater or spend 6 to trade. First 2 trades free. Energy for trade costs ~7-9 MC, so 2 free trades = ~14-18 MC saved.
Titan Floating Launch-pad.reasoning: Provides 2 free trades, then trades every other gen. benbever values it highly but the 21 MC upfront without ti payment is steep. Krazyguy75 notes trading with energy is ~5 MC, so breakeven is 3 trades. Jovian tag is valuable for multipliers. Solid but not game-changing without floater support.
Titan Floating Launch-pad.when_to_pick: When you need a trade fleet alternative and/or Jovian tag. Better early when you can use all the free trades.

Titanium Mine.name: Titanium Mine
Titanium Mine.economy: 7+3=10 MC for 1 ti-prod (12.5 MC) + Building tag (~1-2 MC). Net value ~3.5 MC gen 1. Breaks even by gen 2. Simple and efficient.
Titanium Mine.reasoning: Boring and fine as shai_aus says. 10 MC for 1 ti-prod is a good deal gen 1, paying for itself in 2 turns. Building tag is a small bonus. ad_hocNC warns about Asteroid Mining Consortium stealing it. Low impact but reliable early economy card. Better gen 1-2, skip after gen 3.
Titanium Mine.when_to_pick: Gen 1-2 always. Simple production card. Skip after gen 3 as ti-prod loses value.

Aerial Mappers.name: Aerial Mappers
Aerial Mappers.economy: 11+3=14 MC for 1 VP (5 MC) + Venus tag (2-3 MC) + action: 1 card every 2 gens (~1.5-2 MC/gen). Breakeven in ~4-5 gens.
Aerial Mappers.reasoning: A solid but slow card-draw engine. 1 free card every 2 gens is decent value, and the ability to add floaters to any card provides flexibility for floater strategies. However, 14 MC is expensive for the slow payoff, and the card is much better in longer engine games. In 3P/WGT where games are ~8-9 gens, you get maybe 3-4 cards total, which is acceptable but not exciting.
Aerial Mappers.when_to_pick: Gen 1-3 in a Venus/floater engine. Skip after gen 4 unless you have strong floater synergy.

CEO's Favorite Project.name: CEO's Favorite Project
CEO's Favorite Project.economy: 1+3=4 MC for ~1 VP (5 MC) typically. With Physics Complex: 2 VP (10 MC). No tags = -3 to -5 penalty. Event with no tags.
CEO's Favorite Project.reasoning: Cheap VP card -- 4 MC for 1 VP on a 1-VP-per-animal card, or 2 VP on Physics Complex. The no-tag penalty hurts, but the extremely low cost partially compensates. Event type counts for Legend milestone. Requires a card with resources already on it. Low impact but efficient when you have a good target. Not worth drafting highly but rarely a bad play if you have an animal/science resource card.
CEO's Favorite Project.when_to_pick: When you have a 1-VP animal or Physics Complex with resources. Good for Legend milestone. Low draft priority.

Corona Extractor.name: Corona Extractor
Corona Extractor.economy: 10+3=13 MC (ti-payable) for 4 energy-prod (30 MC) + Space+Power tags (2-3 MC). 4 Science tag requirement. 3.25 MC/energy-prod is excellent.
Corona Extractor.reasoning: Incredible energy production rate (3.25 MC per energy-prod) but locked behind 4 Science tags. The poor man's Quantum Extractor -- cheaper but lacks the -2 space discount and science tag. Ti-payable via Space tag is useful. With Colonies, 4 energy is extremely valuable for trading. The 4 Science requirement means mid-game earliest. No Science tag on it means it does not feed the science engine further.
Corona Extractor.when_to_pick: When you have 4 Science tags and need energy, especially with Colonies. Ti-payable is a plus.

Directed Heat Usage.name: Directed Heat Usage
Directed Heat Usage.economy: 1 MC + 3 MC card = 4 MC cost. Action: 3 heat → 4 MC (~1.5 MC profit) or 3 heat → 2 plants (~3.5 MC profit). No tags = -3 to -5 penalty.
Directed Heat Usage.reasoning: Cheap and flexible heat conversion. The 2 plants option is quite good (~5 MC value for 3 heat ~3.5 MC). No tags hurts, but the ultra-low cost partially compensates. Per shai_aus, low investment with handy flexibility. Best when heat is abundant (Helion, post-temperature-max). Stall value as a cheap blue action.
Directed Heat Usage.when_to_pick: When heat production is high and temperature is near max. Good cheap pickup anytime.

Floyd Continuum.name: Floyd Continuum
Floyd Continuum.economy: 4 MC + 3 MC card = 7 MC cost. Action: 3 MC per completed parameter (temp, O2, oceans, Venus = 4 total). Late game: 9-12 MC per action. Science tag (~4 MC). No COTD data.
Floyd Continuum.reasoning: Late-game money generator that scales with terraforming completion. With 3 parameters done: 9 MC per action is excellent. With Venus as 4th: 12 MC. But early game it's nearly worthless. The Science tag is nice for engine builders. No COTD data available so relying on card math. At 7 MC cost with a Science tag, the floor is acceptable and the ceiling (12 MC/action late) is strong. Marked 'no COTD data' for review.
Floyd Continuum.when_to_pick: Gen 1-3 for speculation on late-game income. Better in longer games where parameters complete over time.

Great Dam:promo.name: Great Dam:promo
Great Dam:promo.economy: 15 MC (steel payable) + 3 MC card = 18 MC cost. Returns: 2 energy-prod (~15 MC gen1) + 1 VP (~5 MC) + tile placement bonus (~3 MC) + Power+Building tags (~3 MC). Total ~26 MC. Req 4 oceans.
Great Dam:promo.reasoning: Promo version is 3 MC more expensive but adds a tile placement that must be adjacent to ocean. The tile provides a placement bonus and map presence. Per game economics, the 3 MC premium for a tile placement is fair to slightly positive. Otherwise same evaluation as original Great Dam — decent mid-game energy with VP, limited by 4 ocean requirement.
Great Dam:promo.when_to_pick: Mid game with 4+ oceans and good ocean-adjacent placement available. Slightly better than original Great Dam.

Miranda Resort.name: Miranda Resort
Miranda Resort.economy: Cost 12+3=15 MC (ti payable). Value: 1 VP (5) + Jovian+Space tags (4-7) + MC-prod per Earth tag. At 3 Earth tags = 15 MC-prod. Total ~24-27 with 3 tags.
Miranda Resort.reasoning: Decent MC production if you have 3+ Earth tags, plus Jovian tag for multipliers. But doesn't include its own Earth tag (unlike Cartels), making it strictly worse for economy. The Jovian tag adds value for multipliers and milestones. shai_aus rates Cartels higher. Best for Point Luna/Teractor with many Earth tags.
Miranda Resort.when_to_pick: When you have 3+ Earth tags for MC-prod, or need a cheap Jovian tag. Ti-payable helps late game.

Nitrophilic Moss.name: Nitrophilic Moss
Nitrophilic Moss.economy: Cost 8+3=11 MC - 2 plants (~4). Value: 2 plant-prod (16 MC gen 1). Net ~+1 to +5 MC. Plant tag (1-2). Req: 3 oceans + 2 plants.
Nitrophilic Moss.reasoning: Good plant production card -- basically Algae at 2 MC less with easier requirement (3 oceans vs 5). The 2 plant cost is manageable. icehawk84 calls it underrated and the best of the mosses. Plant tag is useful for NRA/Insects/Ecologist. Not flashy but solid when played early-mid game.
Nitrophilic Moss.when_to_pick: Gen 2-4 when 3 oceans are out and you have 2+ plants. Good plant tag for NRA/Insects synergy.

Noctis City.name: Noctis City
Noctis City.economy: Cost 18+3=21 MC (steel payable) + 1 energy-prod (~7.5). Value: 3 MC-prod (15-18) + city (1-3 VP from greeneries) + City+Building tags (2-3). On Tharsis: +3-4 VP from greeneries.
Noctis City.reasoning: Map-dependent value. On Tharsis it's strong -- the reserved area often has great adjacency for greeneries and the 'surprise city' play catches opponents. icehawk84 rates it very strong on Tharsis, not great elsewhere. The -1 energy-prod cost is annoying early but irrelevant last gen. shai_aus likes it as a late-game play on Tharsis.
Noctis City.when_to_pick: On Tharsis: high priority, buy early and play late for surprise city. On other maps: mediocre, only with excess steel.

Plantation.name: Plantation
Plantation.economy: Cost 15+3=18 MC. Value: 1 greenery + O2 TR (7-7.4) + placement bonuses (2-4) + Plant tag (1-2). SP greenery = 23 MC. This saves 5 MC. Total ~10-14 MC.
Plantation.reasoning: A cheaper standard project greenery (saves 5 MC) with a useful Plant tag. The 2 Science tag requirement is manageable but limits who can play it. Good for NRA enablement and Gardener milestone. ad_hocNC values the plant tag highly. shai_aus calls it fine. No science tag on it means it doesn't feed into science engines.
Plantation.when_to_pick: When you have 2 science tags and need a greenery or plant tag. Mid-game discount on SP greenery.

Self-replicating Robots.name: Self-replicating Robots
Self-replicating Robots.economy: 10 MC total (7+3) for action: add 2 resource, OR remove resources from card to discount a building/space card by that amount. No tags = -3 to -5 penalty. Req: 2 Science tags.
Self-replicating Robots.reasoning: Interesting but slow. Needs 4 actions (2 gens) to accumulate enough resources for a meaningful discount. benbever shows gen 1 play leads to 32 MC discount by gen 5. Krazyguy75 argues the effective rate is poor unless you maintain 1 card per 4 turns pace. No tags penalty. Good with Viron. Niche but can be strong when set up properly.
synergies: Big space/building cards (Deimos Down, Io Mining)
Self-replicating Robots.when_to_pick: Early game with 2 science tags and expensive cards to target. Loses value after gen 3-4.

Towing A Comet.name: Towing A Comet
Towing A Comet.economy: 23+3=26 MC (ti-payable) for 1 ocean TR (7 MC) + 1 O2 TR (7 MC) + 2 plants (4 MC) + placement bonus (~2-4 MC). Total ~20-22 MC value at face. Space tag for ti payment brings cost to ~16-18 MC effective.
Towing A Comet.reasoning: Standard terraforming event. icehawk84 highlights the 'towing into conversion' play (place ocean, convert plants to greenery for 3 TR in one turn). FieldMouse007 says 'not great points-wise but good enough.' Ti-payable and 20+ MC cost for Credicor discount help. Solid mid-game rusher card.
Towing A Comet.when_to_pick: Mid-game when you can pay with ti and combo with plant conversion. Good for rush strategies.

Lava Flows.name: Lava Flows
Lava Flows.reasoning: 2 temp raises + placement. Standard project-like efficiency.

Advanced Alloys.name: Advanced Alloys
Advanced Alloys.economy: 9+3=12 MC. Need to spend 12+ steel/ti to break even. Science tag worth 3-5 MC. With IC (20 steel), value is ~20 MC from steel alone.
Advanced Alloys.reasoning: Situational card that is good with heavy metal production (IC, Phobolog, Supply Drop) but mediocre otherwise. As COTD commenters note, it is overrated by new players. Many games you do not produce enough metal to justify 12 MC. The Science tag adds value but is not enough on its own. With the right corporation/preludes it can be strong, but often you end up with unused metal anyway.
Advanced Alloys.when_to_pick: Gen 1-2 with IC, Phobolog, or heavy metal preludes. Skip if you have less than 3 metal-prod or few Building/Space targets.

Bribed Committee.name: Bribed Committee
Bribed Committee.economy: 7+3=10 MC for 2 TR (14 MC) - 2 VP (-10 MC). Net: 4 MC value. Earth tag (2-3 MC). Immediate TR is valuable early for income.
Bribed Committee.reasoning: 2 TR for 10 MC is below-rate (5 MC/TR vs standard 7 MC/TR), but the -2 VP claws back most of the savings. The key insight is that TR gives immediate income while VP only scores at game end. Gen 1-2, each TR produces ~6-7 MC over remaining gens, so 2 TR = 12-14 MC income. The -2 VP costs ~10 MC equivalent. Net benefit from early play is positive. Earth tag adds synergy. Event tag counts for Legend. Gets worse as game progresses.
Bribed Committee.when_to_pick: Gen 1-3 when you need immediate income boost. The earlier, the better. Skip after gen 4.

Cryo-Sleep.name: Cryo-Sleep
Cryo-Sleep.economy: 10+3=13 MC for Science tag (3-5 MC) + 1 VP (5 MC) + trade discount (saves 1 energy/MC per trade = ~5-7 MC/gen per fleet). Total ~13-17 MC.
Cryo-Sleep.reasoning: Decent Colonies support card. The -1 trade cost effectively saves 1 energy per trade, which is ~7.5 MC value per gen. With 2 trade fleets the saving doubles. Science tag + VP add ~8-10 MC. At 13 MC total cost, it pays off in 1-2 gens with active trading. However, it is expensive compared to Rim Freighters (7 MC for same effect, Space tag, no VP). Good for science players who trade actively.
Cryo-Sleep.when_to_pick: When playing Colonies and need a Science tag. Better with 2+ trade fleets. Skip without active colony trading.

Cupola City.name: Cupola City
Cupola City.economy: 16 MC (steel payable) + 3 MC card + ~7 MC energy prod = ~26 MC cost. Returns: 3 MC-prod (~15 MC gen1), city tile (~10-16 MC), City+Building tags (~3 MC). Total value ~28-34 MC.
Cupola City.reasoning: A decent but unexciting city card. Better than SP city but not by a huge margin once you account for the energy production cost. The max 9% oxygen requirement limits late-game play but is rarely an issue. Per shai_aus and benbever, it's middle-of-the-road — playable but not exciting. Steel payability is the main draw.
Cupola City.when_to_pick: Early game with steel to dump and spare energy production. Good for Mayor milestone on Tharsis.

Earth Elevator.name: Earth Elevator
Earth Elevator.economy: 43 MC (ti payable) + 3 MC card = 46 MC cost. Returns: 3 ti-prod (~37.5 MC gen1, ~45 MC with Turmoil) + 4 VP (~20 MC late) + Space+Earth tags (~4 MC). Total ~61-69 MC value gen1.
Earth Elevator.reasoning: Massive investment card with awkward timing. Production + VP hybrid means it's suboptimal both early (VP wasted) and late (production wasted). Per community consensus, the 43 MC cost is brutally expensive and essentially ends your turn. Per Krazyguy75, it can be absurd with Turmoil Unity bonus. Best played mid-game gen 3-5, but that timing is hard to hit. Good with Phobolog's starting titanium.
Earth Elevator.when_to_pick: Gen 2-4 with Phobolog or substantial titanium reserves. Skip if you can't play it before gen 5.

Extremophiles.name: Extremophiles
Extremophiles.economy: 3 MC + 3 MC card = 6 MC cost. Action: add 1 microbe to ANY card. 1 VP per 3 resources. 2 Science tag req. Venus+Microbe tags (~4 MC). Cheapest Venus tag speculation.
Extremophiles.reasoning: Cheap microbe dispenser with VP accumulation. The 'add microbe to ANY card' is the key strength — feeds GHG Producing Bacteria, Ants, or Decomposers. Per warpspeed100, always speculate on if you have science tags. The VP accumulation (1 per 3) is slow on its own but adds up. Venus+Microbe dual tag is good for Venuphile and Splice synergies. At 6 MC it's low-risk speculation.
Extremophiles.when_to_pick: Early game with 2 science tags and microbe targets. Good cheap Venus tag for speculation.

GHG Factories.name: GHG Factories
GHG Factories.economy: 11 MC (steel payable) + 3 MC card + ~7 MC energy prod = ~21 MC cost. Returns: 4 heat-prod (~16 MC gen1) + Building tag (~2 MC). Total ~18 MC. Slight value deficit.
GHG Factories.reasoning: Decent heat production for temperature rushing. The 4 heat production enables 1 temperature raise every 2 gens (with 8 heat). Per community, heat production is one of the weaker productions but 4 at once is substantial for rushing. The Building tag and steel payability help. However, at full cost (with energy from SP), 21 MC for 16 MC of heat-prod is bad. Only good with cheap/free energy production.
GHG Factories.when_to_pick: Gen 1-3 with spare energy production and a temperature rushing strategy. Good steel dump.

Great Dam.name: Great Dam
Great Dam.economy: 12 MC (steel payable) + 3 MC card = 15 MC cost. Returns: 2 energy-prod (~15 MC gen1) + 1 VP (~5 MC) + Power+Building tags (~3 MC). Total ~23 MC. Requires 4 oceans.
Great Dam.reasoning: Solid energy production with VP bonus, but the 4 ocean requirement limits timing. By the time 4 oceans are down, you're in mid-game where energy production is worth less (unless for Colonies). The 1 VP and dual tags add value. Steel payable is good. Per community, it's a decent mid-game play but not exciting. Better than Geothermal Power thanks to the VP, but the requirement hurts flexibility.
Great Dam.when_to_pick: Mid game with 4+ oceans and need for energy production. Good steel dump with tags and VP.

Heather.name: Heather
Heather.economy: 6 MC + 3 MC card = 9 MC for 1 plant prod (~8 MC) + 1 plant (~1 MC) + Plant tag (~2 MC) = ~11 MC value. Fair price, slightly positive.
Heather.reasoning: Decent but unremarkable plant production card. The -14C requirement means it's playable early-mid game in most games. Plant tag is valuable for NRA, Insects, Ecologist milestone. Not exciting but solid role-player that fills a niche. Compared to better options like Bushes or Kelp Farming, it's underwhelming.
Heather.when_to_pick: When building plant engine and need cheap plant tags. Don't prioritize in draft unless plant synergies are strong.

Jupiter Floating Station.name: Jupiter Floating Station
Jupiter Floating Station.economy: 9 MC + 3 MC card = 12 MC for Jovian tag (~3-5 MC) + 1 VP (~5 MC) + Action: add floater/spend 4 floaters for 4 MC. Requires 3 Science tags. Cheap Jovian tag.
Jupiter Floating Station.reasoning: Primarily valued as a cheap Jovian tag for multiplier VP. The floater action is slow (4 turns to activate MC mode) and the 4 MC payoff is mediocre. The 3 Science tag requirement delays deployment. Best as a floater holder for Titan colony and other floater placement cards. The MC generation is just a bonus if it activates.
Jupiter Floating Station.when_to_pick: When you need a cheap Jovian tag for multipliers and have 3 Science tags. Or as a floater target for Titan colony.

Maxwell Base.name: Maxwell Base
Maxwell Base.economy: Cost 18+3=21 MC + 1 energy-prod (~7.5). Value: 3 VP (15) + City+Venus tags (3) + action (free floater/animal). Total ~18+action. Net slightly negative without synergy.
Maxwell Base.reasoning: The 3 VP is decent but expensive. The action becomes strong with Stratospheric Birds (free VP per gen). Without a floater/animal target, it's an overpriced VP card. The 12% Venus requirement and energy cost limit when it can be played. icehawk84 notes it scores heavily with the right target.
Maxwell Base.when_to_pick: When you have a 1VP animal/floater card to feed. Late-game 3 VP dump if Venus is high. Strong with Strat Birds combo.

Power Plant.name: Power Plant
Power Plant.economy: 7 MC total (4+3) for 1 energy prod (worth ~7.5 MC). Fair price but low impact. Two tags (Power+Building) add ~2-3 MC value. Steel payable.
Power Plant.reasoning: Solid utility card with good tags for its cost, but very low impact. It is never a high draft priority, just a reliable filler when you need energy. Better with steel or discounts. COTD confirms it is a 'keeper but not exciting' card.
Power Plant.when_to_pick: Early-mid game when you need energy production and have steel to spend. Good filler in weak draft packs.

Refugee Camps.name: Refugee Camps
Refugee Camps.economy: 13 MC total (10+3) for 1 VP/gen action (costs -1 MC-prod each). Played 3 gens before end: 13+3 MC-prod-loss = 16 MC for 3 VP = 5.3 MC/VP. Earth tag worth 2-3 MC.
Refugee Camps.reasoning: Decent VP card when played 3-4 gens before game end with excess MC production. FieldMouse007 says 'strong but tricky to use.' Each VP costs 1 MC-prod, which is painful early but fine late. Earth tag is nice. Camp resources cannot be eaten by Predators/Virus. Safe but unexciting VP engine.
Refugee Camps.when_to_pick: Mid-game when you have high MC production and 3+ gens remaining. Not worth forcing.

Soil Enrichment.name: Soil Enrichment
Soil Enrichment.economy: 9 MC total (6+3) + 1 microbe = 10-12 MC total for 5 plants (~11 MC, 5/8 of a greenery). Microbe+Plant event tags. Good tags for synergies.
Soil Enrichment.reasoning: Decent late-game card for converting a spare microbe into 5 plants (often enough for a greenery with existing plants). Microbe+Plant tags trigger many synergy effects. FieldMouse007 calls it 'fine.' SoupsBane shows it is roughly fairly priced. Best when the microbe would otherwise be wasted (odd number on half-VP card).
Soil Enrichment.when_to_pick: Late game when you have a spare microbe and need plants for a greenery. Good free draw.

Sponsors.name: Sponsors
Sponsors.economy: 6+3=9 MC for 2 MC-prod + Earth tag. 4.5 MC/prod is decent. Earth tag worth ~2-3 MC. Total value ~12-13 MC gen 1 over 8 gens. Breaks even by gen 5.
Sponsors.reasoning: Basic economy card that is fine early but drops off sharply. benbever confirms 4.5 MC/prod is good, but Krazyguy75 argues 18 MC return from 9 MC invested over 10 gens is not impressive. Earth tag adds genuine value with Point Luna, Teractor, Cartels. Solid but not exciting.
Sponsors.when_to_pick: Gen 1-3, or if Earth tag has strong synergy with your corp/engine. Skip after gen 4.

Supported Research.name: Supported Research
Supported Research.economy: 3+3=6 MC for 2 cards (6-8 MC) + Science tag (~3-5 MC). Net positive on card value alone. Cheapest Science tag along with Search for Life.
Supported Research.reasoning: Great card for its cost when the Scientists requirement is met - effectively free card draw with a valuable science tag. However, Scientists are rarely ruling, and placing 2 delegates costs resources. benbever notes it's 'best played midgame when you may need cards or science tags.' Turmoil requirement adds variance.
Supported Research.when_to_pick: When Scientists are ruling or you have 2 delegates there. Cheap science tag is always welcome but the requirement limits reliability.

Toll Station.name: Toll Station
Toll Station.economy: 12+3=15 MC (ti-payable) for 1 MC-prod per opponent Space tag. In 3P: typically 2-4 opponent space tags gen 1. At 3 tags: 3.75 MC/prod decent. Late game: Banker award swing.
Toll Station.reasoning: Highly variable. benbever does detailed analysis showing it needs 4+ opponent space tags gen 1 to compete with Acquired Company. In 3P with all expansions, that's uncommon early. Best value is as a late-game Banker award swing card. Prelude 2 adds more space tags making it slightly better.
Toll Station.when_to_pick: Gen 1-2 if opponents have 3+ space tags. Late game for Banker award. In 3P, usually a mid-tier card.

Worms.name: Worms
Worms.economy: 8+3=11 MC for N plant-prod where N = microbe tags/2 (including this). At 3 microbe tags: 2 plant-prod (16 MC). At 5: 3 plant-prod (24 MC). Microbe tag ~1-2 MC. Req 4% O2.
Worms.reasoning: Scaling plant production based on microbe tags. At 3 microbe tags total it's already decent (16 MC for 11 MC). At 5+ tags it's excellent. The 4% O2 requirement is moderate. Microbe tag contributes to Ecologist and enables microbe synergies. Key card in bio-heavy strategies.
Worms.when_to_pick: When you have 2+ microbe tags and expect more. Scales very well in microbe-heavy builds. 4% O2 is usually met by gen 3-4.

Artificial Lake.name: Artificial Lake
Artificial Lake.economy: 15+3=18 MC for 1 ocean (14 MC) + 1 VP (5 MC) + Building tag (1-2 MC). Total ~20 MC. Steel-payable. Same cost as SP ocean but with VP and placement flexibility.
Artificial Lake.reasoning: Effectively an SP ocean with 1 VP and flexible placement for the same price. Steel-payable is nice. The special placement on non-ocean areas is situationally valuable for Estate Dealer award, blocking opponents, or Capital synergy. The -6C requirement means oceans might already be gone. Decent steel dump with a VP bonus but nothing exciting.
Artificial Lake.when_to_pick: When you have steel surplus and -6C is met. Good for Estate Dealer on Elysium. Medium priority.

Crash Site Cleanup.name: Crash Site Cleanup
Crash Site Cleanup.economy: 4+3=7 MC for 1 VP (5 MC) + 1 ti (3 MC) or 2 steel (4 MC). Net cost ~0-1 MC for 1 VP. No tags = -3 to -5 penalty. Requirement: plant removal this gen.
Crash Site Cleanup.reasoning: Nearly free VP when the requirement is met. 7 MC minus 3-4 MC resource gain = 3-4 MC for 1 VP, which is one of the cheapest VPs available. The no-tag penalty and event-with-no-tags limitation hurt. The requirement (plants removed this gen) is met in most games since asteroids are common. You can even trigger it yourself. Low impact but efficient. Good as a wheel pick in draft.
Crash Site Cleanup.when_to_pick: Low draft priority but keep if you have or expect plant removal events. Nearly free VP.

Eos Chasma National Park.name: Eos Chasma National Park
Eos Chasma National Park.economy: 16 MC (steel payable) + 3 MC card = 19 MC cost. Returns: 2 MC-prod (~10 MC gen1), 1 VP (~5 MC), 3 plants (~6 MC), 1 animal to another card (~5 MC), Plant+Building tags (~3 MC). Total ~29 MC.
Eos Chasma National Park.reasoning: A decent steel dump with lots of small bonuses. Per benbever, good mid-late game if you have steel and plant synergy. The -12°C requirement limits timing. The 1 animal is only valuable if you have a 1-VP-per-animal card already. Per shai_aus, it's a bit expensive for what it does and needs an animal card to be worth it. The Plant+Building tags help NRA and Builder.
Eos Chasma National Park.when_to_pick: Mid-late game with steel, an animal card in play, and plant synergy. Decent steel dump for last generation.

Floater Prototypes.name: Floater Prototypes
Floater Prototypes.economy: 2 MC + 3 MC card = 5 MC cost. Returns: 2 floaters to another card. Typically worth 1 VP, 1 TR, 1 MC-prod, or 1 card draw depending on target. Science tag (event) ~4 MC.
Floater Prototypes.reasoning: Cheap and efficient when you have a good floater target. 2 floaters typically translate to 1 TR or 1 VP worth ~5-7 MC, making this 5 MC for ~5-7 MC value — a small profit. The Science tag triggers Mars University and Olympus Conference. Per community, it's not always worth drafting at 3 MC, but great when drawn for free. Best with high-value floater targets like Forced Precipitation (instant Venus raise) or Aerial Mappers.
Floater Prototypes.when_to_pick: When you have a strong floater target and need a cheap Science tag trigger. Low priority without targets.

Fusion Power.name: Fusion Power
Fusion Power.economy: 14 MC + 3 MC card = 17 MC cost. Returns: 3 energy-prod (~22.5 MC gen1) + Power+Building tags (~3 MC). Total ~25.5 MC. Requires 2 Power tags.
Fusion Power.reasoning: Strong energy production card with restrictive requirement. 3 energy production for 17 MC is excellent efficiency (~5.7 MC per energy-prod). However, 2 Power tags are relatively rare and hard to accumulate quickly. Per community, the Power+Building dual tags are decent. Best with Thorgate (already has Power tag on corp). The energy is valuable for Colonies trading, city cards, and Physics Complex.
Fusion Power.when_to_pick: When you already have 2 Power tags (usually gen 2-4). Excellent energy efficiency when the requirement is met.

Io Sulphur Research.name: Io Sulphur Research
Io Sulphur Research.economy: 17 MC + 3 MC card = 20 MC for 2 VP (~10 MC) + Science+Jovian tags (~6-8 MC) + 1 card (3 MC) or 3 cards with 3 Venus tags (~10 MC). Without Venus tags: ~19 MC value. With: ~28 MC value.
Io Sulphur Research.reasoning: Overpriced without the 3 Venus tag bonus. At 20 MC for 2 VP and 1 card, you're paying a premium for the Science+Jovian tags. With 3 Venus tags the 3 cards make it reasonable. Not ti-payable which hurts. Late game Science+Jovian tags can be very valuable for multiplier VP and engine payoffs. Very situational.
Io Sulphur Research.when_to_pick: When you need Science+Jovian tags and have 3+ Venus tags for the bonus cards. Otherwise pass.

Jovian Envoys.name: Jovian Envoys
Jovian Envoys.economy: 2 MC + 3 MC card = 5 MC for 2 delegates (SP ~10 MC). Saves 5 MC. Requires 2 Jovian tags. No tags on card = no synergy.
Jovian Envoys.reasoning: Good value for delegate placement if you're already playing Jovians. Getting 2 delegates for 5 MC vs 10 MC standard is solid savings. Can secure Chairman or party control. But the 2 Jovian tag requirement limits it to Jovian strategies, and no tags on the card itself (event, no tags) means no ongoing value. Situationally strong in Turmoil games.
Jovian Envoys.when_to_pick: When playing Jovians in Turmoil games and need delegate placement. Otherwise not worth drafting.

Local Heat Trapping.name: Local Heat Trapping
Local Heat Trapping.economy: 1 MC + 3 MC card = 4 MC + 5 heat (~6.25 MC) = ~10 MC cost. Gain 4 plants (~8 MC) or 2 animals on 1VP card (2 VP = ~10 MC). No tags = -3 to -5 penalty.
Local Heat Trapping.reasoning: Efficient conversion of surplus heat into plants or animal VP. The animal mode is excellent on a 1VP animal card (2 VP for ~10 MC). Plant mode gives half a greenery. No tags is a real penalty but the low cost and heat-to-value conversion make it worthwhile. Best as a free draw when you have surplus heat. Low impact but positive expected value.
Local Heat Trapping.when_to_pick: When you have surplus heat and a 1VP animal card. Good as a free draw. Don't draft early without heat production.

Medical Lab.name: Medical Lab
Medical Lab.economy: Cost 13+3=16 MC (steel payable). Value: 1 VP (5) + Science+Building tags (4-7) + 1 MC-prod per 2 building tags. At 4 buildings = 2 MC-prod (10-12). Total ~19-24.
Medical Lab.reasoning: Situationally good but requires many building tags to be efficient. In all-expansion play, building tag density is lower than base game. Krazyguy75 notes expansions hurt this card. The Science+Building tag combo is excellent for milestones/awards. Best with Mining Guild or steel-heavy strategies.
Medical Lab.when_to_pick: When you have 4+ building tags and can pay with steel. Good late-game steel dump for VP + science tag.

Molecular Printing.name: Molecular Printing
Molecular Printing.economy: Cost 11+3=14 MC. Value: 1 VP (5) + Science tag (3-5) + 1 MC per city and colony in play. In 3P late game: ~8-12 cities+colonies = 8-12 MC. Net ~2-8 MC.
Molecular Printing.reasoning: Player-count and timing dependent. In 3P with colonies, late game could see 8-12 combined cities+colonies. The science tag and 1 VP are always useful. Krazyguy75 rates it balanced to bonkers depending on context. FieldMouse007 calls it mediocre. In 3P all-expansions it's solidly average -- a free VP+science tag with some MC back.
Molecular Printing.when_to_pick: Late game when colonies and cities have accumulated. The science tag may enable other plays.

Public Baths.name: Public Baths
Public Baths.economy: 9 MC total (6+3) - 6 MC refund = net 3 MC for 1 VP + Building tag. Very efficient VP. Steel payable makes it even cheaper.
Public Baths.reasoning: Cheap VP card with 6 ocean requirement. Net cost of ~3 MC for 1 VP is excellent. Building tag adds utility. Requirement means mid-late game play. Simple, efficient, low-impact card. icehawk84 notes it breaks pricing principles at just 3 MC net for a VP.
Public Baths.when_to_pick: Mid-late game when 6 oceans are placed. Very good free draw, decent late draft pick for easy VP.

Small Animals.name: Small Animals
Small Animals.economy: 9 MC total (6+3) for half-VP animal action + Animal tag. 6% O2 requirement. -1 plant prod (take-that minor). Typically 2 VP self-generated. Animal tag adds synergy value.
Small Animals.reasoning: Half-VP animals are significantly weaker than full-VP ones like Birds/Fish. 2 VP for 9 MC is decent but not exciting. The -1 plant prod in 3P is a minor take-that penalty. Animal tag provides Eco Zone/Decomposers synergy. benbever notes it is good with Large Convoy placement. Solid but uninspiring.
Small Animals.when_to_pick: When you need an animal tag/placement target and have no better options. Mid-game play.

Urban Decomposers.name: Urban Decomposers
Urban Decomposers.economy: 6+3=9 MC for 1 plant-prod (8 MC) + 2 microbes on another card (~2-5 MC) + Microbe tag (~1-2 MC). Req 1 city + 1 colony. Total ~11-15 MC value.
Urban Decomposers.reasoning: Decent cheap card when requirements are met (usually gen 2-3). benbever says 9 MC for a plant production is 'not bad at all' and the 2 microbes add value. Similar to Archaebacteria but for mid-game. The dual requirement of city + colony is usually easy by mid-game. Good filler with microbe synergy.
Urban Decomposers.when_to_pick: When you have a city + colony and a good microbe target. Cheap enough to include in most bio strategies.

Vesta Shipyard.name: Vesta Shipyard
Vesta Shipyard.economy: 15+3=18 MC (ti-payable) for 1 ti-prod (12.5 MC) + 1 VP (5 MC) + Jovian+Space tags (~5-7 MC). Total value ~23-25 MC. Jovian tag premium: only paying ~1 MC for the tag.
Vesta Shipyard.reasoning: benbever calculates you pay only 1 MC for the Jovian tag over the ti-prod + VP. With Saturn Systems, it's excellent (+1 MC-prod too). The Jovian tag adds multiplier potential. shai_aus says 'decent.' Late game it's a ti dump for 1 VP. Solid Jovian economy card but not spectacular on its own.
Vesta Shipyard.when_to_pick: With Jovian strategy or Saturn Systems. Also fine as early ti-prod + Jovian tag. Skip if no Jovian synergy.

Venus Shuttles.name: Venus Shuttles
Venus Shuttles.reasoning: Venus raise action. Slow but repeatable.

Energy Tapping.name: Energy Tapping
Energy Tapping.reasoning: -1 energy-prod opponent + gain 1. Take-that penalty в 3P. -1 VP.

Vermin.name: Vermin
Vermin.reasoning: 2 био-тега за дёшево. Action для VP.

16 Psyche.name: 16 Psyche
16 Psyche.economy: 31+3=34 MC for 2 ti-prod (25 MC) + 3 ti (9 MC) + 2 VP (10 MC) = 44 MC value. Net +10, but heavy upfront cost. Ti-payable via Space tag helps. 4.25 MC/ti-prod effective.
16 Psyche.reasoning: Decent ti-production card with 2 VP and immediate titanium, but very expensive upfront (34 MC). The Space tag helps pay with titanium. Comparable to Asteroid Mining but slightly better value due to immediate ti and lower real cost after ti offset. Still, the high investment gen 1 is crippling and you need space cards to spend the titanium on.
16 Psyche.when_to_pick: When you have ti-production or Phobolog and need a ti dump with VP. Best gen 1-2, skip after gen 3.

Breathing Filters.name: Breathing Filters
Breathing Filters.economy: 11+3=14 MC for 2 VP (10 MC) + Science tag (3-5 MC). Total ~13-15 MC. Fair value. 7% oxygen requirement is mid-game.
Breathing Filters.reasoning: Simple VP card: 2 VP + Science tag for 14 MC. At 7 MC/VP, it is fair but not exciting. The Science tag adds value for engine players needing science requirements. The 7% oxygen requirement means mid-to-late game play, which is fine since VP cards are better later. Consistent, reliable, never exciting. Good Science tag enabler when you need one more.
Breathing Filters.when_to_pick: When you need a Science tag and 7% oxygen is close. Acceptable as a late-game VP dump. Not high priority.

Building Industries.name: Building Industries
Building Industries.economy: 6+3=9 MC + 1 energy-prod (~7.5 MC) = 16.5 MC effective. 2 steel-prod (16 MC). Building tag (1-2 MC). Fair conversion.
Building Industries.reasoning: Cheap energy-to-steel conversion at 9 MC sticker price. If you have unused energy production, converting 1 energy-prod to 2 steel-prod is excellent (energy=7.5, steel=16). But if you need a SP Power Plant for the energy, total cost balloons to 20 MC. The Building tag is useful for milestones. Best with excess energy from other cards. Situationally good but requires the right setup.
Building Industries.when_to_pick: When you have energy-prod to spare and want steel for building cards. Gen 1-3 with energy prelude.

Diaspora Movement.name: Diaspora Movement
Diaspora Movement.economy: 7 MC + 3 MC card = 10 MC cost. Returns: 1 VP (~5 MC late) + X MC where X = Jovian tags in play. With 3-4 Jovian tags: 3-4 MC back. Net cost ~3-6 MC for 1 VP + Jovian tag (~4 MC).
Diaspora Movement.reasoning: A niche Jovian tag card with 1 VP. The MC gain is nice but not transformative. The Reds ruling requirement adds friction — you may need to spend delegates. Per benbever, with Jovian multipliers this can be worth up to 5 VP, but that's the ceiling case. The Jovian tag is the real value. Boring but occasionally useful.
Diaspora Movement.when_to_pick: Mid-late game with 2+ Jovian tags and Reds conveniently ruling or delegates to spare.

Floater Technology.name: Floater Technology
Floater Technology.economy: 7 MC + 3 MC card = 10 MC cost. Action: 1 floater to ANOTHER card per gen. Science tag (~4 MC). Floater value depends on target: ~1.5-3 MC per gen effective.
Floater Technology.reasoning: An affordable Science tag with floater dispensing action. Per benbever, the floater can translate to half a card, half a TR, or half a VP per gen depending on target. At 10 MC total with the Science tag, it's reasonable if you have even one good floater target. Per PanzerWatts, without a floater target the 10 MC Science tag is expensive compared to other options. Cheap enough for low-risk speculation.
Floater Technology.when_to_pick: Gen 1-4 with at least one floater card in play. Good cheap Science tag for Warp Drive or Anti-Gravity requirements.

Fuel Factory.name: Fuel Factory
Fuel Factory.economy: 6 MC (steel payable) + 3 MC card + ~7 MC energy prod = ~16 MC cost. Returns: 1 ti-prod (~12.5 MC gen1) + 1 MC-prod (~5 MC gen1) + Building tag (~2 MC). Total ~19.5 MC.
Fuel Factory.reasoning: Decent value if you have spare energy production, but a trap if you need to buy energy. Per icehawk84, top 10 overrated card — people overplay it mid-game. Per shai_aus, it's not as cheap as it appears due to hidden energy cost. Per benbever, good value for money gen 1 with pre-existing energy production. The titanium production is the draw, but only worthwhile if you have space cards to spend it on.
Fuel Factory.when_to_pick: Gen 1-2 with spare energy production from preludes/corp. Skip if you'd need to SP Power Plant first.

Herbivores.name: Herbivores
Herbivores.economy: 12 MC + 3 MC card = 15 MC. 8% oxygen requirement = mid-late game. Gains ~1 VP per 2 greeneries placed (by anyone). Self-scores 2-4 VP typically. Take-that component (-1 plant prod) in 3P is a minus.
Herbivores.reasoning: Interesting VP-generating animal card but awkward execution. The 8% oxygen requirement means it comes online mid-late game when fewer greeneries are being placed. The 1/2 VP per resource ratio is half of Birds/Fish. Plant prod attack in 3P helps the third player. Better in base game without expansions diluting the deck.
Herbivores.when_to_pick: When you need an animal tag and can't find Birds/Fish/Livestock. Better in plant-heavy metagames where many greeneries are placed.

Inventors' Guild.name: Inventors' Guild
Inventors' Guild.economy: 9 MC + 3 MC card = 12 MC for Science tag + repeatable card draw (3 MC per card kept). Over 5 gens: 5 draws, maybe keep 3 = 12 + 9 = 21 MC for 3 cards. ~7 MC/card is expensive.
Inventors' Guild.reasoning: Continuous card draw is powerful in TM but this implementation is expensive and slow. At 12 MC upfront plus 3 MC per card kept, the per-card cost is high. In 8-gen games with WGT, you get maybe 4-5 uses which isn't enough to justify the investment. Better in longer 2P games. The Science tag is its saving grace for milestone/payoff purposes.
Inventors' Guild.when_to_pick: Gen 2-3 when building science engine and game looks to go 9+ gens. Pass in short 8-gen games unless you need the Science tag.

Lake Marineris.name: Lake Marineris
Lake Marineris.economy: 18 MC + 3 MC card = 21 MC. 2 VP + 2 oceans (2 TR + placement bonuses). At full value: ~24-28 MC. But requires 0C AND 2 ocean spots available. No tags = -3 to -5 penalty.
Lake Marineris.reasoning: When played for full value (both oceans), it's one of the best cards in the game. But the 0C requirement combined with needing 2 ocean spots makes full value uncommon in 3P. Oceans typically fill before temp hits 0C. No tags means no discounts, no synergies. Even for 2 VP alone at 21 MC it's poor. High variance card - amazing ceiling, disappointing floor.
Lake Marineris.when_to_pick: Speculate in opening hand if you plan to rush temperature. Draft mid-game only if oceans remain near 0C temp.

Lichen.name: Lichen
Lichen.economy: 7 MC + 3 MC card = 10 MC for 1 plant prod (~8 MC) + Plant tag (~2 MC). Requires -24C. Total: ~10 MC value. Fair price.
Lichen.reasoning: Decent cheap plant card playable relatively early (-24C is often gen 1-2). The Plant tag is valuable for NRA, Insects, and Ecologist milestone. At 10 MC for 10 MC value it's break-even, but the early playability and tag value push it to useful territory. Not exciting but reliable. Good role-player for plant strategies.
Lichen.when_to_pick: When building plant strategy and need cheap plant tags. Draft priority goes up with NRA/Insects in hand.

Lightning Harvest.name: Lightning Harvest
Lightning Harvest.economy: 8 MC + 3 MC card = 11 MC for 1 energy prod (~7.5 MC) + 1 MC-prod (~5 MC) + 1 VP (~5 MC) + Power tag (~1 MC). Requires 3 Science tags. Total: ~18.5 MC value.
Lightning Harvest.reasoning: Good value at 11 MC for ~18 MC when requirements are met. The 3 Science tag requirement limits it to science engine players who often have better options (Quantum Extractor, Mass Converter). The Power tag is niche. The card is efficient but rarely urgent or game-changing. You need to happen to have 3 Science tags, need energy, and have this in hand simultaneously.
Lightning Harvest.when_to_pick: When you have 3+ Science tags and need energy production. Good incidental value, not a strategy-defining pick.

Lunar Beam.name: Lunar Beam
Lunar Beam.economy: 13 MC + 3 MC card + 10 MC (-2 MC-prod) = ~26 MC effective cost. Gain 2 heat prod (~8 MC) + 2 energy prod (~15 MC) + Earth+Power tags (~3 MC) = ~26 MC value. Break-even.
Lunar Beam.reasoning: Fair-priced but painful production card. The -2 MC-prod is a significant hit early game when MC is most valuable. The combined heat + energy production is strong for rushing or colony trading. Earth+Power tags provide some synergy value. Much better with Teractor/Earth Office where the MC-prod loss is offset. Good for heat terraforming strategy that also needs energy.
Lunar Beam.when_to_pick: Gen 1-2 when going heat rush AND need energy for colonies/other cards. Better with Earth tag discounts.

Magnetic Shield.name: Magnetic Shield
Magnetic Shield.economy: Cost 24+3=27 MC (ti payable). Value: 4 TR = ~29.6 MC. Net ~+3 MC. Space tag worth 1-2 MC. Requirement: 3 Power tags is steep.
Magnetic Shield.reasoning: Good value on paper -- 4 TR for 27 MC is solid, especially titanium-payable. But 3 Power tags is a difficult requirement that limits when this can be played. Per COTD experts, it's a fine VP dump card but you can't rely on meeting the requirements. Niche but decent when it works.
Magnetic Shield.when_to_pick: When you already have 2 power tags and titanium to spend. Late-game titanium dump when requirements are met.

Moss.name: Moss
Moss.economy: Cost 4+3=7 MC - 1 plant (~2). Value: 1 plant-prod (8 MC) + Plant tag (1-2). Total ~9-10 MC. Net ~0-3 MC accounting for plant loss.
Moss.reasoning: Simple, cheap plant production with a useful Plant tag. The 3 ocean requirement is easy to meet by gen 2-3. Losing 1 plant is minor. shai_aus calls it perfectly fine mid-tier. The Plant tag is valuable for NRA/Insects. Not exciting but functional. Better as part of a plant engine than standalone.
Moss.when_to_pick: Gen 2-4 when 3 oceans are out and you want plant production or a cheap plant tag.

Nuclear Power.name: Nuclear Power
Nuclear Power.economy: Cost 10+3=13 MC (steel payable) + 2 MC-prod lost (10). Total ~23 MC gen 1. Value: 3 energy-prod (22.5). Net ~-0.5 MC gen 1, better mid-game.
Nuclear Power.reasoning: Good when you need lots of energy (colonies trading, oxygen bumpers, Physics Complex). The -2 MC-prod hurts early but matters less mid-late game. benbever notes mid-game effective cost is only ~19 MC for 3 energy. Power+Building tags are useful. Preferred: Peroxide Power for smaller needs.
Nuclear Power.when_to_pick: When you specifically need 3 energy production. With colonies it's good in opening hand. Without specific energy needs, skip.

Permafrost Extraction.name: Permafrost Extraction
Permafrost Extraction.economy: Cost 8+3=11 MC. Value: 1 ocean (TR 7-7.4 + placement bonus 2-6). Total ~9-13 MC. No tags = penalty (-3 to -5). Req: -8C.
Permafrost Extraction.reasoning: Cheap ocean that's 7 MC less than SP, which is good value. But the -8C requirement means it's mid-game at earliest, and no tags means penalty. Risk of oceans being maxed by the time temperature reaches -8C. shai_aus rates it fine with manageable requirement. Better with event rebates (IC, Media Group).
Permafrost Extraction.when_to_pick: When temperature is near -8C and oceans remain. Don't speculate early. Good as mid-game free draw.

Rad-Chem Factory.name: Rad-Chem Factory
Rad-Chem Factory.economy: 11 MC total (8+3) + 1 energy prod (~7.5 MC) = effective ~18.5 MC for 2 TR (~14.8 MC). Slight overpay but Building tag + steel payable helps. Late game: 11 MC for 2 VP = 5.5 MC/VP.
Rad-Chem Factory.reasoning: Decent late-game VP card when you have excess energy. icehawk84 calls it 'Bad-chem Factory' but acknowledges it is not terrible with steel. The -1 energy prod makes early play expensive. Best as last-gen steel dump with spare energy. Building tag helps for milestones.
Rad-Chem Factory.when_to_pick: Late game when you have excess energy production and steel. Not worth drafting early.

Rego Plastics.name: Rego Plastics
Rego Plastics.economy: 13 MC total (10+3) for steel +1 value + 1 VP + Building tag. Need to spend ~8 steel after playing to break even. With 2+ steel prod, effectively 2 MC-prod equivalent.
Rego Plastics.reasoning: Decent with significant steel production, but steel is often hard to spend on building cards late game. shai_aus says it is 'pretty severely overrated' for most games. 1 VP provides floor value. Building tag helps. Worse than Advanced Alloys. Best with IC opening hand or high steel production.
Rego Plastics.when_to_pick: When you have 2+ steel production and many building cards to play. Late game it is just 1 VP.

Shuttles.name: Shuttles
Shuttles.economy: 13 MC total (10+3) + 1 energy prod (~7.5 MC) = effective ~20.5 MC for 2 MC-prod (~10 MC) + 2 MC space discount/card + 1 VP + Space tag. Requires 5% O2.
Shuttles.reasoning: Mid-game engine card that loses to the timing problem: by 5% O2, MC production matters less. -1 energy is painful. icehawk84 says 'low impact' and prefers Space Station. shai_aus is skeptical. The space discount is decent for heavy space strategies but the card comes online too late for the production to matter much.
Shuttles.when_to_pick: Mid-game for space engine builders with excess energy. Not a high priority card.

Small Asteroid.name: Small Asteroid
Small Asteroid.economy: 13 MC total (10+3) for 1 temp TR (~7-7.4 MC) + remove 2 plants + Space tag. Ti payable. Slightly better than SP asteroid (14 MC). Minor take-that in 3P.
Small Asteroid.reasoning: Cheap temperature raise with Space tag, titanium payable. Slightly better than Standard Project. Plant removal is minor in 3P (take-that penalty applies weakly). COTD consensus: 'fine but not exciting.' Better with Optimal Aerobraking. Low-impact, reliable filler card.
Small Asteroid.when_to_pick: When you need temperature TR and have titanium or space discounts. Decent filler.

Solarnet.name: Solarnet
Solarnet.economy: 10 MC total (7+3) for 2 cards (~8 MC) + 1 VP (~5 MC). No tags = -3 to -5 penalty. Req: Venus+Earth+Jovian tags. Total value ~13 MC but requires triple planetary requirement.
Solarnet.reasoning: Decent card draw + VP but the triple planetary requirement (Venus+Earth+Jovian) is restrictive and hard to meet early when card draw matters most. No tags is a significant penalty. Compared unfavorably to Research (4 MC more but double science tag and no requirements). shai_aus: 'slightly better but harder to play SF Memorial.'
Solarnet.when_to_pick: Only when you already meet Venus+Earth+Jovian requirements. Not worth forcing.

Subterranean Reservoir.name: Subterranean Reservoir
Subterranean Reservoir.economy: 11+3=14 MC for 1 ocean (1 TR = 7 MC + placement bonus ~2-4 MC). SP ocean costs 18 MC, saving 4 MC. No tags (event, but no tag value). No-tag penalty applies partially.
Subterranean Reservoir.reasoning: A cheaper ocean - simple and functional. benbever notes the 4 MC savings plus placement bonuses. No tags is a downside, but event tag counts for Legend/Media Group. icehawk84 says 'usually not too excited unless I have event rebates.' Decent but not exciting.
Subterranean Reservoir.when_to_pick: When you need an ocean and have MC but no better options. Good for ocean-walking combos.

Venus Governor.name: Venus Governor
Venus Governor.economy: 4+3=7 MC for 2 MC-prod (10-12 MC) + 2 Venus tags (~4-5 MC). Req 2 Venus tags. At 7 MC for 2 MC-prod, that's 3.5 MC/prod - excellent if played gen 1. Venuphile award clincher.
Venus Governor.reasoning: Sponsors but cheaper and with Venus tags instead of Earth. benbever notes it's great value if played early. The 2 Venus tag requirement limits early play in most games, but Morning Star Inc and Venus Waystation make it free. FieldMouse007 calls it 'mediocre' because buying it doubles the cost and Venus tags have less value than Earth.
Venus Governor.when_to_pick: Gen 1-2 if you already have 2 Venus tags. Clinches Venuphile. With discounts it's essentially free value.

Venus Trade Hub.name: Venus Trade Hub
Venus Trade Hub.economy: 12+3=15 MC (ti-payable) for effect (likely trade bonus) + 1 VP + Venus+Space tags. No COTD data. Req 2 Venus tags. Comparable to other Venus combo enablers.
Venus Trade Hub.reasoning: No COTD data available. Based on cost structure: 15 MC ti-payable for 1 VP + effect + Venus+Space tags. The 2 Venus tag requirement limits use. With Colonies compatibility, likely a trade-enhancing effect. The Venus+Space dual tag helps with Venuphile and ti-payment. Mid-tier Venus support card.
Venus Trade Hub.when_to_pick: When playing Venus + Colonies combo and have 2+ Venus tags. Ti-payable makes it accessible.

Media Archives.name: Media Archives
Media Archives.economy: Cost 8+3=11 MC. Value: 1 MC per event ever played. In 3P by late game ~12-18 events = 12-18 MC. Net +1-7 MC. Earth tag (2-3).
Media Archives.reasoning: Late-game money bomb that's hard to time well. In 3P, events accumulate reasonably but you can't play this early (not enough events). icehawk84 says it's almost always strong late in 3P+. The Earth tag adds value. But it occupies hand space while providing zero value until played. Inferior to Investment Loan in flexibility.
Media Archives.when_to_pick: Mid-to-late game when ~15+ events have been played. Don't speculate on it early unless cash is abundant.

Spin-Inducing Asteroid.name: Spin-Inducing Asteroid
Spin-Inducing Asteroid.economy: 19 MC total (16+3) for 2 Venus TR (~14.8 MC). Ti payable. Space event tag. Max 10% Venus requirement limits timing. Slight overpay.
Spin-Inducing Asteroid.reasoning: Previously evaluated at 61/C in calibration data. 2 Venus TR for 19 MC is slightly overpriced. Max 10% Venus limits to early game. Space event tag allows titanium payment and event rebates. Better with Venus payoffs (Venusian Animals, Strato Birds). icehawk84 says 'not the worst if you have Venus payoffs.'
Spin-Inducing Asteroid.when_to_pick: Early game when Venus is low and you have Venus strategy cards. With discounts it becomes efficient.

Symbiotic Fungus.name: Symbiotic Fungus
Symbiotic Fungus.economy: 4+3=7 MC for action: add 1 microbe to any card. At 1/2 VP per microbe (Ants, Decomposers): 0.5 VP/gen = 2.5 MC/gen. Microbe tag worth ~1-2 MC. Req -14C.
Symbiotic Fungus.reasoning: Cheap and can add meaningful VP to microbe cards over several gens. icehawk84 notes for 2 MC more you could play Small Animals which gives 0.5 VP/gen without a target. FieldMouse007 says 'as long as it gives 2+ points, it's very good.' The -14C requirement delays deployment. Needs good microbe targets to shine.
Symbiotic Fungus.when_to_pick: When you have a microbe VP card to feed. Draft speculatively even without one - cheap enough to gamble on finding a target.

Spin-inducing Asteroid.name: Spin-inducing Asteroid
Spin-inducing Asteroid.economy: 2 Venus TR за 19 MC. Ti payable.
Spin-inducing Asteroid.reasoning: 2 Venus TR. Ti payable снижает cost. Event тег.

Advertising.name: Advertising
Advertising.economy: 4+3=7 MC for Earth tag (2-3 MC) + effect. Need 2 triggers (20+ MC cards) for 10 MC production value. Break-even requires 2 expensive cards played early.
Advertising.reasoning: Cheap Earth tag with a conditional effect. The trigger (playing 20+ MC cards) is achievable but not guaranteed -- only ~17% of cards cost 20+. Need at least 2 triggers to be worth it. Good with Credicor and Point Luna. Mostly a cheap Earth tag enabler rather than a strong economy card. In 3P/WGT the game is shorter, making triggers harder to accumulate.
Advertising.when_to_pick: Gen 1 with 2+ expensive cards in hand and/or Point Luna/Credicor. Otherwise treat as a cheap Earth tag.

Beam From A Thorium Asteroid.name: Beam From A Thorium Asteroid
Beam From A Thorium Asteroid.economy: 32+3=35 MC for 3 heat-prod (12 MC) + 3 energy-prod (22.5 MC) + 1 VP (5 MC) + Jovian+Space+Power tags (~6-8 MC). Value ~45 MC. Good if played early. Ti-payable.
Beam From A Thorium Asteroid.reasoning: Great production value on paper (45 MC worth of stuff), but the 35 MC upfront cost and Jovian tag requirement make it hard to deploy early when the production matters most. With Colonies, 3 energy-prod is very useful for trading. With ti-payment the effective cost drops significantly. But the Jovian requirement means you need Saturn Systems, a Jovian prelude, or another expensive Jovian card first. Situationally strong, often stranded in hand.
Beam From A Thorium Asteroid.when_to_pick: Gen 1-3 with Saturn Systems or Jovian prelude + titanium. Excellent with Colonies for energy. Skip without Jovian tag.

Deuterium Export.name: Deuterium Export
Deuterium Export.economy: 11 MC + 3 MC card = 14 MC cost. Action: 1 floater per gen, convert to energy-prod. Gives ~1 energy-prod every 2 gens = ~3.75 MC/gen average. Triple tag value (Space+Venus+Power) ~5 MC.
Deuterium Export.reasoning: Slow energy production generator with 3 useful tags. On its own, getting energy production every other gen is underwhelming. But with Celestic/Stormcraft for floaters every gen, it becomes solid. The triple tag is genuinely valuable for Diversifier and Aridor. Per icehawk84, it can be very good with Celestic specifically; otherwise mostly ignorable.
Deuterium Export.when_to_pick: With floater-generating corporations or when you need the triple tag for Diversifier. Otherwise low priority.

GHG Import From Venus.name: GHG Import From Venus
GHG Import From Venus.economy: 23 MC (ti payable) + 3 MC card = 26 MC cost. Returns: 1 Venus TR (~7.2 MC) + 3 heat-prod (~12 MC gen1) + Space+Venus+Event tags (~5 MC). Total ~24.2 MC.
GHG Import From Venus.reasoning: Overpriced bundle of Venus TR and heat production. At 26 MC for ~24 MC value, it's slightly below cost even at gen 1 valuations. The triple tag (Space+Venus+Event) is the best feature. Ti payability helps with Phobolog. Per community assessment, it's rarely exciting — you're paying premium for Venus you might not want and heat production that's mediocre. Better with Aphrodite or Terraforming Deal for Venus TR bonus.
GHG Import From Venus.when_to_pick: Early game with titanium to spend and Venus TR synergies. Skip if you don't benefit from Venus.

Hi-Tech Lab.name: Hi-Tech Lab
Hi-Tech Lab.economy: 17 MC + 3 MC card = 20 MC. 1 VP. Action: spend N energy to look at N cards, keep 1. Each use costs energy resources (~1.5 MC each). Net card quality improvement worth ~2-3 MC per use above base.
Hi-Tech Lab.reasoning: Expensive for what it does. The action is essentially paying energy to get a curated card draw, but you only keep 1 card regardless of how many you spend. Science + Building tags are good, and 1 VP helps, but 20 MC upfront is steep. Works best with excess energy production from science engines but those situations are uncommon in 8-gen games.
Hi-Tech Lab.when_to_pick: When you have strong energy production and need card filtering. Science engine support piece. Pass in most situations.

Immigrant City.name: Immigrant City
Immigrant City.economy: 13 MC + 3 MC card + 7.5 MC (1 energy prod) + 10 MC (2 MC-prod loss) = ~33.5 MC. City tile worth ~2 VP. Effect: +1 MC-prod per city placed. Need 5+ cities to recover production loss.
Immigrant City.reasoning: Classic noob trap when played early. The production hit is devastating in competitive 3P games where not enough cities are placed to justify it. Per icehawk84 stats, early play has a very bad win rate in 3P. However, as a late-game cheap city (steel payable, -2 MC-prod is irrelevant last gen) it's decent. Building + City tags are valuable.
Immigrant City.when_to_pick: Late game as a cheap city tile and steel dump. Do NOT play early in 3P despite the temptation.

Import of Advanced GHG.name: Import of Advanced GHG
Import of Advanced GHG.economy: 9 MC + 3 MC card = 12 MC for 2 heat prod (~8 MC gen 1). At 6 MC per heat prod, it's ok in gen 1. Earth+Space event tags enable heavy discounts.
Import of Advanced GHG.reasoning: Fair-priced heat production card that improves dramatically with discounts. Earth+Space event tags open up the most discount possibilities in the game (Optimal Aerobraking, Media Group, IC, Earth Office, etc.). Without discounts it's merely average at 6 MC per heat prod. With 2-3 discounts it becomes good. Better in gen 1 when heat prod has full value.
Import of Advanced GHG.when_to_pick: Gen 1-2 when going for heat terraforming and have discount infrastructure. With Optimal Aerobraking it's excellent.

Industrial Center.name: Industrial Center
Industrial Center.economy: 4 MC + 3 MC card = 7 MC. Building tag. Tile placement adjacent to city. Action: spend 7 MC for 1 steel prod. Steel prod action is rarely worth it.
Industrial Center.reasoning: Cheap tile placement that can grab placement bonuses and block opponent greenery spots. The steel production action is almost never worth using in 3P all-expansions where games are short. Primary value is as a cheap Building tag, tile placement for bonuses, and positional disruption. Good for Builder milestone. Teleport value near cities.
Industrial Center.when_to_pick: When good placement bonuses are available near cities, or need Building tag for milestone. Don't count on the action.

Martian Survey.name: Martian Survey
Martian Survey.economy: Cost 9+3=12 MC. Value: 2 cards (6-8) + 1 VP (5) + Science tag (3-5). Total ~14-18 MC. Decent but max 4% O2 limits timing.
Martian Survey.reasoning: Overpriced for what it does without discounts. 12 MC for 2 blind draws + 1 VP is mediocre early game when you'd rather have production. The max 4% O2 requirement means it can only be played early. With rebates (IC, Media Group, Valley Trust) it becomes much better. Science+Event tags enable combos.
Martian Survey.when_to_pick: When you have event/science rebates. Also good for Legend milestone. Don't speculate on it if O2 might spike early.

Minority Refuge.name: Minority Refuge
Minority Refuge.economy: Cost 5+3=8 MC + 2 MC-prod lost (10). Total effective ~18 MC for a colony (SP costs 17). Space tag (1-2). Late game: -2 prod irrelevant.
Minority Refuge.reasoning: Early game it's slightly worse than SP colony due to MC-prod loss. But it's titanium-payable via Space tag and gets better late-game when the -2 MC-prod doesn't matter. Good for grabbing placement bonuses (Europa ocean, Miranda animal) cheaply in final gens. benbever provides detailed analysis of niche scenarios.
Minority Refuge.when_to_pick: Late game for colony placement bonuses when -2 MC-prod is irrelevant. Early game only if securing a critical colony spot.

Mohole Lake.name: Mohole Lake
Mohole Lake.economy: Cost 31+3=34 MC (steel payable). Value: 1 temp TR (10) + 1 ocean (14) + 3 plants (7.5) + action (microbe or animal). Total ~31.5 + action. Slightly negative base.
Mohole Lake.reasoning: Big, expensive card that does many things but none amazingly. The terraforming value roughly equals cost. The action is nice with GHG Bacteria or 1VP animals but requires additional cards. Steel-payable is a big plus. COTD consensus: it's okay but conflicted between terraforming and engine. Best as a steel dump with a microbe/animal target.
Mohole Lake.when_to_pick: With excess steel AND a microbe/animal target for the action. Don't play just for the terraforming.

Omnicourt.name: Omnicourt
Omnicourt.economy: Cost 11+3=14 MC (steel payable). Value: 2 TR (14.8) + Building tag (1-2). Total ~16 MC. Net ~+2 MC. Req: Venus+Earth+Jovian tags.
Omnicourt.reasoning: 2 TR for 14 MC steel-payable is decent. The triple planetary tag requirement limits when you can play it. icehawk84 rates it what Release of Inert Gases should have been. FieldMouse007 calls it mediocre. As a steel dump with tags already met, it's fine. Not worth bending strategy for.
Omnicourt.when_to_pick: When you naturally have Venus+Earth+Jovian tags and excess steel. Late-game steel dump for TR.

Political Alliance.name: Political Alliance
Political Alliance.economy: Cost 4+3=7 MC. Value: 1 TR (7-7.4). No tags = penalty (-3 to -5). Req: 2 party leaders. Net ~-2 to -5 MC with tag penalty.
Political Alliance.reasoning: Cheap TR card that's decent when the requirement is met. No tags is a penalty. benbever rates it good, noting 2 party leaders isn't hard in low player counts. It's a useful event for Legend milestone. shai_aus finds it boring but playable. The Turmoil requirement limits availability. Overall a filler card with narrow upside.
Political Alliance.when_to_pick: When you have 2 party leaders and need cheap TR. Good for Legend milestone. Low priority in draft.

Power Supply Consortium.name: Power Supply Consortium
Power Supply Consortium.economy: 8 MC total (5+3) for 1 energy prod. Fair price, but requires 2 Power tags (hard to meet early). Take-that component hurts in 3P format.
Power Supply Consortium.reasoning: The attack is meaningful but the 2 Power tag requirement is restrictive and often hard to fulfill when you most need it. In 3P, stealing energy helps the third player. icehawk84 notes Energy Tapping is slightly better due to no requirement. Decent but situational.
Power Supply Consortium.when_to_pick: When you already have 2 Power tags and can disrupt an opponent's plans. Less useful in 3P than 2P.

Red Appeasement.name: Red Appeasement
Red Appeasement.economy: 3 MC total (0+3) for 2 MC-prod (~10-12 MC early). Requires Reds ruling or 2 delegates + no other player passed. Forces you to pass immediately.
Red Appeasement.reasoning: Excellent efficiency when it works - 3 MC for 2 MC-prod is outstanding. But the requirement is very restrictive: Reds ruling is uncommon, and 'no other player passed' limits timing. Passing immediately is a significant cost. No tags penalty. benbever rates it well but acknowledges it is hard to trigger.
Red Appeasement.when_to_pick: When Reds are ruling and you are first to act. Very niche but powerful when conditions align.

Solar Probe.name: Solar Probe
Solar Probe.economy: 12 MC total (9+3) for X cards (1 per 3 science tags including this) + 1 VP + Space+Science event tags. Ti payable. With 5 tags: 2 cards. With 8: 3 cards.
Solar Probe.reasoning: Expensive for card draw unless you have many science tags. icehawk84 says 'event tag really hurts - below 5 tags it is worse than Lagrange Observatory.' Krazyguy75 agrees it is overpriced. At 5+ science tags it becomes decent. 1 VP + event with Space tag means discounts/rebates can help. C-tier for the average case.
Solar Probe.when_to_pick: Late game with 5+ science tags and space discounts. Not worth forcing.

Soletta.name: Soletta
Soletta.economy: 38 MC total (35+3) for 7 heat prod (~42 MC gen 1). Ti payable. 5.43 MC per heat prod. Space tag. Huge investment for heat only.
Soletta.reasoning: Classic gen 1 rush card that has been somewhat replaced by the cheaper Solar Reflectors. 38 MC is nearly all of gen 1 budget. shai_aus says 'value drops steeply after gen 1-2.' benbever notes it is 'a few MC too expensive.' The 7 heat prod guarantees 1 temp/gen but leaves you with no other economy. Better in 2P where you control game pace more.
