Icy Impactors.reasoning: Too slow and expensive for multiplayer. The upfront cost of 18 MC plus 10 MC per ocean (over 2 actions) is inefficient compared to direct ocean-placing events. Not choosing placement is a significant downside. The action-intensive nature means fewer productive turns. Only reasonable in solo where you have more control over game length.
Icy Impactors.when_to_pick: Almost never in 3P. Only if you have massive titanium surplus and no better space cards.

Land Claim.name: Land Claim
Land Claim.economy: 1 MC + 3 MC card = 4 MC to reserve a board spot. No tags = -3 to -5 penalty. Value depends entirely on the spot reserved.
Land Claim.reasoning: Very niche card that pays 4 MC to reserve a spot rather than just taking it. In 3P, blocking one opponent helps the third player. The no-tag penalty is significant. Occasionally useful for blocking ocean walks on Tharsis or grabbing a key spot. Much better in 2P. Best as a free draw where it costs only 1 MC. Not worth drafting in most situations.
Land Claim.when_to_pick: Only as a free draw or when a specific board position is critical. Not worth drafting.

Magnetic Field Generators.name: Magnetic Field Generators
Magnetic Field Generators.economy: 20 MC + 3 MC card + 28 MC (4 energy prod) = ~51 MC for 3 TR (~21 MC) + 2 plant prod (~16 MC) + tile (~2-4 MC) + Building tag. Total: ~39-41 MC value. ~10 MC deficit.
Magnetic Field Generators.reasoning: Massively overpriced when you account for energy production cost. The 4 energy production requirement is nearly impossible to meet without a full science engine, and even then the value doesn't justify the cost. The Big Box buff adding a tile helps slightly. Only viable as a last-gen steel dump with excess energy from science cards. The 3 TR is nice but not at this price.
Magnetic Field Generators.when_to_pick: Last gen with 4+ unused energy production and steel. Otherwise completely skip. One of the most overcosted cards in the game.

Nitrite Reducing Bacteria.name: Nitrite Reducing Bacteria
Nitrite Reducing Bacteria.economy: Cost 11+3=14 MC. Value: starts with 3 microbes. Action: +1 microbe or spend 3 microbes for 1 TR (7-7.4). First TR immediate. Then 1 TR per 3 actions = ~2.3 MC/action. Microbe tag (1-2).
Nitrite Reducing Bacteria.reasoning: Too slow and expensive. 14 MC upfront for something that generates 1 TR immediately then 1 TR every 3 actions. shai_aus repeatedly rates it poorly across multiple COTD threads. ad_hocNC calls it bad and a trap for UNMI. The TR doesn't end the game faster (Venus-like). Only useful with microbe colony/external microbe sources.
Nitrite Reducing Bacteria.when_to_pick: Almost never. Only with multiple microbe-adding sources that make it produce TR faster.

Parliament Hall.name: Parliament Hall
Parliament Hall.economy: Cost 8+3=11 MC (steel payable). Value: 1 VP (5) + Building tag (1-2) + 1 MC-prod per 3 building tags. At 6 buildings = 2 MC-prod (10). Total ~16-17. Req: Mars First. Worse Medical Lab.
Parliament Hall.reasoning: Strictly inferior to Medical Lab: costs 5 MC less but gives 1 MC-prod per 3 tags instead of per 2, has a party requirement, and no science tag. Community consensus is D-tier. The VP makes it playable as a cheap steel dump but the production effect is too weak. benbever notes it's used mainly as a late-game 1VP steel dump.
Parliament Hall.when_to_pick: As a cheap 1VP steel dump with Mars First ruling. Don't draft for the production effect.

Power Grid.name: Power Grid
Power Grid.economy: Cost 18+3=21 MC. No steel/ti payment. Value: energy-prod per Power tag. At 3 tags = 3 energy-prod (22.5). At 2 tags = 2 (15). Power tag (1). Overpriced and circular.
Power Grid.reasoning: Overpriced energy production that can't be discounted by steel/titanium. If you already have enough Power tags to make it efficient, you probably already have enough energy. shai_aus, ad_hocNC, and FieldMouse007 all rate it poorly. The community notes it's likely overcosted by the game designers. Very niche, very situational.
Power Grid.when_to_pick: Almost never. Only with 3+ existing Power tags and desperate need for energy. Thorgate makes it more playable.

Space Mirrors.name: Space Mirrors
Space Mirrors.economy: 6 MC total (3+3) for action: spend 7 MC for 1 energy prod. Only useful with colonies needing energy. Power+Space tags. 7 MC/energy is same as SP Power Plant minus the SP premium.
Space Mirrors.reasoning: The action is very expensive at 7 MC per energy production - same rate as a Standard Project. shai_aus says 'maybe a bit better than SP, but that is not high praise.' ad_hocNC recommends 'just do not play it ever and your winrate will go up.' Tags provide some value. Only niche use is Colonies when you desperately need energy without other options.
Space Mirrors.when_to_pick: Almost never. The action is too expensive. Only if you desperately need energy for colonies.

Steelworks.name: Steelworks
Steelworks.economy: 15+3=18 MC for an action spending 4 energy for 2 steel (6 MC) + 1 O2 TR (7 MC) = ~13 MC per action. Need 2+ activations to break even. Building tag worth ~1-2 MC.
Steelworks.reasoning: Oxygen bumpers are generally bad in multiplayer as greeneries handle O2 efficiently while providing VP. shai_aus prefers the titanium version. Steel output is hard to use without city cards. Very niche - only with excess energy (Mass Converter) and O2 not yet maxed.
Steelworks.when_to_pick: Only when you have excess energy production and need to deny plant players O2 points. Rarely correct to play.

Food Factory.name: Food Factory
Food Factory.reasoning: Конфликт с plant strategy. No tags.

Rotator Impacts.name: Rotator Impacts
Rotator Impacts.reasoning: Floater trap. 2 действия на 1 TR = слишком медленно.

Aerobraked Ammonia Asteroid.name: Aerobraked Ammonia Asteroid
Aerobraked Ammonia Asteroid.economy: 26+3=29 MC for 3 heat-prod (12 MC) + 1 plant-prod (8 MC) + 2 microbes (~2-4 MC). Total ~24 MC value. Overpays by 5 MC. Ti-payable helps.
Aerobraked Ammonia Asteroid.reasoning: Too expensive for what it gives, as benbever notes the production is not discounted at all. 3 heat-prod is underwhelming without additional heat sources. 1 plant-prod alone produces nothing. The 2 microbes are hard to place gen 1 when you want to play this. Even with ti payment and Optimal Aerobraking, the card is below average. You want production early but this costs too much for mixed weak production.
Aerobraked Ammonia Asteroid.when_to_pick: Almost never. Only with significant ti discount + Optimal Aerobraking + microbe card already in play.

Insulation.name: Insulation
Insulation.economy: 2 MC + 3 MC card = 5 MC. Convert heat prod to MC prod 1:1. No tags = -3 to -5 penalty. Useful only when heat prod is no longer needed.
Insulation.reasoning: Extremely niche card. No tags means no synergy value. Converting heat prod to MC prod is only useful when temp is maxed and you have excess heat production, which is uncommon in 3P games with WGT. Main use case is swinging Banker award. With Manutech you get MC when production changes. Otherwise nearly useless.
Insulation.when_to_pick: Only when Banker award is funded and this could swing it, or temp is maxed and you have 3+ heat prod to convert.

Martian Rails.name: Martian Rails
Martian Rails.economy: Cost 13+3=16 MC. Action: spend 1 energy for X MC (X = cities on Mars). At 3 cities = 3 MC/action. Break-even at ~6 cities = gen 5+ typically. Energy cost = ~2 MC.
Martian Rails.reasoning: Too expensive, too slow. In 3P games, experienced players don't build many cities, so this rarely reaches 4-5 MC/action. The energy cost is real. COTD experts (shai_aus, ad_hocNC, Krazyguy75) all rate it poorly. It breaks even at 6 cities which rarely happens early enough to matter.
Martian Rails.when_to_pick: Almost never. Only if the table is city-heavy and you have excess energy. Even then there are better options.

Pioneer Settlement.name: Pioneer Settlement
Pioneer Settlement.economy: Cost 13+3=16 MC + 2 MC-prod lost (10) = ~26 MC total. Value: colony (~13) + 2 VP (10) + Space tag (1-2). Total ~24-25 MC. Net ~-1 to -2 MC. Req: max 1 colony.
Pioneer Settlement.reasoning: The worst colony-placing card. The max 1 colony requirement means it can only be played gen 1-2 early, but losing 2 MC-prod early for VP is terrible economy. benbever calculates ~3.5 MC deficit. EspritFort rates it the worst colony card. Standard project colony is strictly better in most cases. Only niche use is late-game titanium dump for 2VP if you somehow still have 0-1 colonies.
Pioneer Settlement.when_to_pick: Almost never. Late game with 0-1 colonies and titanium to spend. Even then it's marginal.

Power Infrastructure.name: Power Infrastructure
Power Infrastructure.economy: Cost 4+3=7 MC (steel payable). Action: energy -> MC at 1:1 rate. Energy worth ~1.4 MC used, so losing ~0.4/energy. Power+Building tags (2-3).
Power Infrastructure.reasoning: The action is almost always a bad trade since energy is worth more than MC when used properly (for trading, bumping, heat). The Power+Building tags for 7 MC steel-payable are the real value -- useful for Builder/Diversifier milestones. icehawk84 says he almost exclusively plays it for milestones. One of the weaker cards.
Power Infrastructure.when_to_pick: Only for Builder/Diversifier milestone tags. The action is almost never worth using. Cheap steel dump.

Soil Factory.name: Soil Factory
Soil Factory.economy: 12 MC total (9+3) + 1 energy prod (~7.5 MC) = effective ~19.5 MC for 1 plant prod (~8 MC) + 1 VP (~5 MC) + Building tag. Massively overpriced.
Soil Factory.reasoning: Terrible card per community consensus. shai_aus calls it 'deceptively expensive.' Krazyguy75 says it is just the default cost of plant production with energy cost for a VP tacked on. No plant tag (can't enable NRA). One of the worst cards in the base game. Only playable as a last-gen steel dump with excess energy.
Soil Factory.when_to_pick: Almost never. Last-gen steel dump with spare energy if you need 1 VP. Bottom-tier card.

Stratopolis.name: Stratopolis
Stratopolis.economy: 22+3=25 MC for 2 MC-prod (10 MC) + city tile + 1/3 VP floater action. Can't pay with steel/ti. benbever calculates: gen 1 play gives 14 MC back + 5 VP in 8-gen game, but 25 MC gen 1 is a massive hit.
Stratopolis.reasoning: Overpriced at 25 MC with a science tag requirement. The 1/3 VP floater rate is terrible unless redirecting floaters to better Venus cards. Most commenters agree it's expensive and rarely sees play. The floaters can only go to Venus cards, severely limiting combo potential.
Stratopolis.when_to_pick: Only if heavily invested in Venus floater strategy with good targets for floaters. Very niche.

Air Raid.name: Air Raid
Air Raid.economy: 0+3=3 MC + 1 floater (~3 MC) cost = 6 MC spent. Gain 5 MC, opponent loses 5 MC. In 3P: net swing against one player = 5 MC, but helps 3rd player free.
Air Raid.reasoning: The no-tag penalty and take-that pattern in 3P makes this weak. You spend 3 MC + a floater (worth 2-3 MC) to steal 5 MC. Net gain ~1-2 MC. In 3P the third player benefits from the targeted player being weakened. The floater cost is significant since floaters are usually needed for VP or other actions. Only okay if drawn for free with no floater opportunity cost.
Air Raid.when_to_pick: Only if drawn for free, have spare floaters, and can target the leader. Low priority in draft.

Floater Leasing.name: Floater Leasing
Floater Leasing.economy: 3 MC + 3 MC card = 6 MC cost. Returns: 1 MC-prod per 3 floaters you have. No tags = -3 to -5 penalty. Typically 1-2 MC-prod mid-game if you have floater engine.
Floater Leasing.reasoning: Almost always garbage. Per shai_aus, 'mostly garbage.' Per FieldMouse007, in many games it sucks. The problem: you rarely have many floaters stored (most floater cards spend them), and when you do it's mid-late game when MC-prod is worth little. No tags compounds the weakness. Only playable with Titan Shuttles or Jovian Lanterns hoarding 10+ floaters, which is extremely niche.
Floater Leasing.when_to_pick: Only when you already have 9+ floaters stored and 3+ gens remaining. Almost never draft this.

Impactor Swarm.name: Impactor Swarm
Impactor Swarm.economy: 11 MC + 3 MC card = 14 MC for 12 heat (~15 MC at 1.25 each) + remove 2 plants (~3 MC). Requires 2 Jovian tags. Value: ~18 MC for 14 MC but timing is terrible.
Impactor Swarm.reasoning: Bizarre card: Jovian players don't want heat (they want long games), and rush players rarely have 2 Jovian tags. The requirement creates a fundamental mismatch with the effect. Even when playable, 12 heat = ~1.5 temp raises which is mediocre for the setup required. Plant removal is minimal impact. Space tag for ti is the only real positive.
Impactor Swarm.when_to_pick: Very rarely. Only when you're Jovian and need to convert titanium into temperature push in the final generation.

Micro-Mills.name: Micro-Mills
Micro-Mills.economy: Cost 3+3=6 MC. Value: 1 heat-prod (4 MC). No tags = penalty (-3 to -5). Net: -5 to -7 MC. Only worth it to reach heat thresholds.
Micro-Mills.reasoning: Overpriced for what it does. No tags is a severe penalty. 6 MC for 1 heat production is barely break-even in gen 1 and bad any later. ad_hocNC notes it has some value for reaching 4 or 8 heat thresholds. COTD consensus is low/zero draft priority. The boring card meme is earned.
Micro-Mills.when_to_pick: Almost never in draft. Play if drawn free and it gets your heat production to a multiple of 8. Generalist milestone edge case.

Security Fleet.name: Security Fleet
Security Fleet.economy: 15 MC total (12+3) for Space tag + action: spend 1 ti for 1 VP. Need ~6 uses to break even. That is 7 gens of play, which is near-impossible to profit from.
Security Fleet.reasoning: Massive trap card. shai_aus says 'amassed lots of titanium with nothing to spend is not a position you want to be in.' Krazyguy75 calculates it needs 6+ activations to break even, calling it 'terrible.' ad_hocNC suggests it may be bottom 3 in the game. VP early is bad principle applies strongly here.
synergies: Excess titanium with no space cards
Security Fleet.when_to_pick: Almost never. Only as a last-gen titanium dump for VP, and even then the 15 MC upfront is steep.

Thermophiles.name: Thermophiles
Thermophiles.economy: 9+3=12 MC for action: add 1 microbe to Venus card or spend 2 for 1 Venus TR. 3 gens per TR = very slow. With extra microbe sources: 1 TR/2 gens is better. Venus+Microbe tags ~3 MC.
Thermophiles.reasoning: Classic floater/microbe trap applied to Venus. Krazyguy75 gives a devastating critique: 12 MC for 1 TR every 3 turns, with a Venus 6% requirement. Even 2 TR total is mediocre. Microbes restricted to Venus cards limits targets. Only works with Extreme-Cold Fungus combo for 1 TR/gen.
Thermophiles.when_to_pick: Only with an external microbe source feeding it every turn. Otherwise skip.

Underground City.name: Underground City
Underground City.economy: 18+3=21 MC (steel-payable) + 2 energy-prod (15 MC) = 36 MC effective for city tile + 2 steel-prod (16 MC). Net loss ~20 MC. Terrible rate.
Underground City.reasoning: Universal consensus that this is awful. shai_aus says 'least-favourite city card.' -2 energy-prod is punishing, and 2 steel-prod is less useful than MC-prod. Community agrees Noctis City does the same job much better. Only playable as a late-game cheap city (steel-payable) when you have excess energy. D tier.
Underground City.when_to_pick: Last gen only with excess energy-prod and steel to pay. Almost never correct to prioritize.

Jet Stream Microscrappers.name: Jet Stream Microscrappers
Jet Stream Microscrappers.economy: 12 MC + 3 MC card = 15 MC. Action: 1 titanium (~3 MC) for 2 floaters, OR spend 2 floaters for 1 Venus TR (~7 MC). 2 actions + 3 MC per Venus TR = slow and expensive.
Jet Stream Microscrappers.reasoning: Classic floater trap. Requires 2 full actions (add floaters, then spend them) for 1 Venus TR, plus titanium cost. Over 8 gens starting gen 1: maybe 3-4 Venus TR for 15 + 12 MC in titanium = 27 MC. That's ~7 MC per Venus TR which is technically ok but the action cost is devastating. Venus track is the least important parameter. Most experienced players instant-pass this.
Jet Stream Microscrappers.when_to_pick: Almost never. Only for Hoverlord milestone or if you have free floater placement. Floater trap card.

Aquifer Pumping.name: Aquifer Pumping
Aquifer Pumping.economy: 18+3=21 MC upfront + 8 MC/ocean (in steel). 1st ocean: 29 MC. 2nd: 18.5/each. 3rd: 15/each. Need 3-4 oceans to approach fair value. In 3P only ~3 oceans per player.
Aquifer Pumping.reasoning: Mathematically bad in 3P/WGT. The first ocean costs 29 MC, and you need 3+ oceans to break even with standard project pricing. In 3P with ~3 oceans per player, you rarely get more than 2-3 uses. Only playable with Mining Guild or IC with massive steel surplus. The steel-payable action is the only redeeming quality. Mostly a trap card.
Aquifer Pumping.when_to_pick: Only with Mining Guild and no other ocean options, or IC with 20+ surplus steel.

Dust Seals.name: Dust Seals
Dust Seals.economy: 2 MC + 3 MC card = 5 MC cost. Returns: 1 VP (~5 MC late game). No tags = -3 to -5 penalty. Max 3 oceans requirement limits to gen 1-2.
Dust Seals.reasoning: One of the worst cards in the game. 5 MC for 1 VP is fair math, but buying VP in gen 1-2 is terrible strategy. The max 3 oceans requirement makes it a dead card most of the game. No tags means zero synergy value. Per benbever, only worth playing if received as a free card, with Vitor (+3 MC back), or for Sagitta (+4 MC). Occasionally helps Tactician on Hellas.
Dust Seals.when_to_pick: Almost never draft this. Only play if received for free or if specific synergies make it cheap enough.

Ice Cap Melting.name: Ice Cap Melting
Ice Cap Melting.economy: 5 MC + 3 MC card = 8 MC for 1 ocean (1 TR ~7 MC + placement bonus ~2-3 MC). But requires +2C. In 95% of games, oceans are maxed before this is playable.
Ice Cap Melting.reasoning: Almost never playable. The +2C requirement means temperature must be near max, and by then oceans are virtually always gone. No tags compounds the problem with no synergy potential. When it works, it's amazing value, but that happens maybe 1 in 20 games. The risk of holding a dead card makes this a poor speculative draft.
Ice Cap Melting.when_to_pick: Only late game when you see it's legal and oceans remain. Never draft early. Never hold in opening hand.

Orbital Reflectors.name: Orbital Reflectors
Orbital Reflectors.economy: Cost 26+3=29 MC (ti payable). Value: 2 Venus TR (14.8) + 2 heat-prod (8) + Venus+Space tags (3-5). Total ~26-28 MC. Net ~-1 to -3 MC. Internal anti-synergy.
Orbital Reflectors.reasoning: Critically anti-synergistic. Venus pushing is engine-oriented but heat production is rush-oriented. You're paying 29 MC for a card that doesn't coherently support either strategy. shai_aus calls it absolute garbage. Community consensus is D/F tier. The heat production on top of expensive Venus raising is design failure.
Orbital Reflectors.when_to_pick: Almost never. Only if Venus is 1-2 steps from the 16% bonus TR and you need the Venus tag for Venuphile.

Venus Magnetizer.name: Venus Magnetizer
Venus Magnetizer.economy: 7+3=10 MC for action: spend 1 energy-prod for 1 Venus TR. At face: 7.5 MC energy for 7 MC Venus TR = slight loss each time. Venus tag ~2-3 MC. Req Venus 10%.
Venus Magnetizer.reasoning: shai_aus and Krazyguy75 are both dismissive. The 10% Venus requirement means Venus is already 5 steps up, and most Venus payoff cards only need 12-18%. So this doesn't enable much. Spending energy-prod for Venus TR is a poor conversion. Only works with excess cheap energy (Robinson, Thorgate) in late game.
Venus Magnetizer.when_to_pick: Very rarely. Only with excess energy-prod and Venus already high. One of the weaker Venus cards.

Asteroid Hollowing.name: Asteroid Hollowing
Asteroid Hollowing.economy: 16+3=19 MC upfront + 1 ti (~3 MC)/action for 1 MC-prod + 1/2 VP. Over 5 gens: spend 15 ti = 45 MC total. Gain 15 MC-prod return + 2.5 VP (12.5 MC). Massive loss.
Asteroid Hollowing.reasoning: One of the worst cards in the game, as COTD unanimously agrees. 19 MC upfront plus titanium per action for slow MC-production and 1/2 VP per asteroid is terrible ROI. The titanium is worth more spent on actual space cards. Even with Astrodrill synergy, the base card is too expensive and too slow. Classic trap card.
Asteroid Hollowing.when_to_pick: Never. Even with Astrodrill, there are better uses for your titanium.

Aerial Lenses.name: Aerial Lenses
Aerial Lenses.economy: 2+3=5 MC for 2 heat-prod (8 MC) - 1 VP (5 MC) - 2 plants removed negligible value. Net ~3 MC. No tags. Kelvinists requirement is restrictive.
Aerial Lenses.reasoning: As all COTD commenters agree, this card is terrible. 2 heat-production for 5 MC seems okay, but the -1 VP makes it a net loss. No tags means zero synergy value. The Kelvinists ruling requirement is restrictive and unreliable. You can get the same effect from the Kelvinist ruling policy itself. One of the worst cards in the game.
Aerial Lenses.when_to_pick: Never. Even in the rare Kelvinists scenario, the -1 VP makes this a trap.

Underground Detonations.name: Underground Detonations
Underground Detonations.economy: 6+3=9 MC for action: spend 10 MC for 2 heat-prod (8 MC). Net loss 2 MC per activation. Building tag ~1-2 MC. One of the worst cards in the game.
Underground Detonations.reasoning: shai_aus's legendary roast says it all - use cases include 'bonfire fuel' and 'bank robbery calling card.' Spending 10 MC for 2 heat-prod (worth 8 MC) is negative value every activation. The Building tag for Builder milestone is literally the only use case. Universally considered one of the worst cards.
Underground Detonations.when_to_pick: Never. If you play this card voluntarily, something has gone terribly wrong.
